Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Kirk W
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Rome and we wanted a budget hotel near the centre. At around £70 a night I wasn’t expecting too much, but the Kennedy delivered generously on nearly all the criteria. The location is perfect, a few minutes walk from the termini. There are plenty of restaurants and facilities nearby. The staff were friendly, coherent, and made things really easy for us. An example is on the last day when we had to leave very early to catch our flight, the staff offered to make us breakfast before the area opened. The breakfast was decent enough, some of the bread was a bit tough but perfectly acceptable. The hotel is immaculate inside and was really impressive, with nice décor which is easy on the eye. The room was a decent size, if a bit dark even with all the lights on. Things I didn’t like so much; the TV was really small and the view from our window overlooked pipes and generators. Neither were big concerns though. For the price The Kennedy really delivers, and I would definitely stay there again. I will be recommending it to any of my friends visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “ONE OF THE BEST HOTELS IN ROME”
Reviews.Author: MAZZY286
Reviews.Content: We needed a nice hotel in Rome for 5 nights....Close to everything whether it was walking distance or catching a bus...We looked on line the location was good close to Termini station the reviews were not to bad so we chose the Hotel Kennedy, when we went to book our trip our Travel Agent said to us there is a good deal with this Hotel Kennedy...So we stayed there....It was excellent from every aspect...Location, .Breakfast, The Room, Bathroom..... were clean, big and spacious .........Loved every minute of Rome and the Kennedy Hotel.... My husband and myself travel once a year for one to three months....And for a European city hotel this was one of the best that has everything combined in one....Recommended to anyone!!!!!!!! MT

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL EVER - DO NOT STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: mloliver
Reviews.Content: We booked 4 nights at the Hotel Kennedy for the first leg of our Europe honeymoon. This was based on a recommendation of our travel agent due to it's central location. Safe to say we will be having words with him when we return!! Both my husband and I have done a lot of travelling and this was easily the worst hotel we have ever stayed and definitely the worst customer service we have ever experienced.  Firstly the rooms are a shoebox with a tv which is even smaller! The hairdryer in our room did not work and when we called to ask for another one they said we could come down ourselves and get it (no offer to bring it up to us). The bathroom is so small that you have to sit diagonally to go to the toilet. However the worst part is the bed! The bed is two single beds pushed togeher which are of very poor quality and very uncomfortable. The bed was so bad that my husband woke up with a migraine due to his neck being out.  On this basis we attempted to check out and get a refund for the second night that we had already paid. This request was met with absolute distain by the front desk. We were advised that it was my "husbands perception" that the bed was bad and that in fact they had people ask them for the company who make the mattresses so they can contact them directly and praise them (not a chance). The main lady at the front desk was so rude to the point that she was yelling at us after we requested our money back. We were told that we would not be getting our money back but they could move us to another room. When we asked if it would be the same bed, she replied "of course". After two other staff members came out the front to have a go at us as well, we decided to forfeit the second nights payment and just cut our losses and not ruin our honeymoon. They basically shooed us out the door.  Worst hotel, worst customer service and worst experience of our 4 week honeymoon. We also lost half a day in Rome due to my husband's migraine and his back played up for the rest of the trip. We then walked across the road to the 4 star hotel "Hotel Morgana" who were only $15 euro extra per night, who were excellent and made the rest of our stay in Rome thoroughly enjoyable.  Please take our advice - do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Well run and central location”
Reviews.Author: CarolGeary
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff, clean hotel with a good continental breakfast. We enjoyed our short stay. But the restaurant directly opposite the hotel on the other side of the street was very disappointing, noisy with lots of students on school trips. there are so many good restaurants in Rome, go further afield to find one.

Reviews.Title: “Best part is the staff”
Reviews.Author: N_Nomads
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights in January 2012. I really want to rate this hotel higher because the staff were very friendly and accomodating, but the rooms left much to be desired. Overall they were really outdated. The bed wasn't that comfortable, very stiff. The room was really dark even with all the lights on. The best part of the room was the bathroom which was surprisingly large. The water pressure in the shower was great, nice and hot. Breakfast was alright, nothing spectacular. Although don't pass up on the delicious made to order cappucinos. Overall I would stay here again if the price was right. This hotel has promise they just need to update their rooms a bit.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For. The Kennedy Was OK.”
Reviews.Author: Jenny9012
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband spent 4 nights at the Kennedy last week and found it to be OK. The room was very clean which was my main concern. however it did need with an update (the bathroom was not great and TV didn't work for example). Staff were friendly and helpful, however didn't offer to help with bags or anything. Breakfast was OK, very basic but it kept us going. I would give this hotel 3* however if i were to go back to Rome again I probably wouldn't stay here again. But what we paid it suited us fine and we were out most of the day. Location is really good, short walk from Termini station and I found it to be quiet and night, some really good restaurants near by also. If your looking for someone clean and to rest your head at night the Kennedy offers just that.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Salcantay
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms in January 2012 (my husband, me, two sons). We visit Rome frequently and have never lodged near Termini. We typically stay in 3 star hotels near Piazza Navona or the Spanish Steps. We have, on occasion, upgraded significantly to other hotels. We were hesitant to do this but we received the rooms through a package with British Airways and determined we would give it a try. We found the front desk staff extremely accommodating. They were helpful with booking a car to the airport as well as following up on restaurant reservations for us. They were very courteous whenever we spoke with them. The rooms are dark and dated. The shower in our room was decent and the size was very suitable. My children complained that their shower felt like pellets. We felt that the rooms and bathrooms were clean. There was a lot of street noise throughout the night (we were on the first floor) particularly a lot of garbage trucks/street sweepers CONSTANTLY driving by. For breakfast I just ate a yogurt and ordered a cappuccino each morning. The staff was friendly and I enjoyed the cappuccino. The location near Termini was nice for us to be able to walk over in the morning and catch a taxi to where we wanted to start our day. We returned back each night via taxi, and the front desk was also happy to call for a taxi for us to take out to dinner. We also felt somewhat safe walking over to Termini at night to buy bottled water. I believe the room contained no safe which concerned us but we had no issues. Overall, if this were given to us in a package we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: Sinatrapug
Reviews.Content: The beds feel plastic like and are extremely uncomfortable. The breakfast is disgusting. Our room had a faulty fan in the bath room that was so loud I was hesitant to use the bathroom at night. The reception staff were rude and on one occasion responded that they were 'very busy' when asked for help. The tv was prehistoric with fuzzy reception. The so called 'wi fi' came at a charge and only worked in the lobby despite advertising otherwise. Close to station but be careful of your belongings - dodgy area

Reviews.Title: “Overhelpful staff except when help is needed”
Reviews.Author: sinnocenti
Reviews.Content: A hotel very much in need of updating and refurbishment with thermostats that do not work resulting in overheated rooms, cold running water, televisions which do not work and cheap almost inedible breakfasts of stale bread, processed cheese, tinned fruit and burnt coffee. Too much information offered on arrival by overhelpful receptionist even when it was obvious to him that this was not desired or needed, but when asked to sort out problems with the rooms he was not helpful. A change of room was only obtained when the desirability of a refund was mentioned. Convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch”
Reviews.Author: Margaret A
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Priceline about 7 months before my stay. I booked for 1 night at a good price, because I was leaving the next day on a cruise. When I arrived at the hotel, I was not asked my name, but rather I was asked to show my booking slip. The instant he saw the slip of paper (or maybe the instant he saw the Priceline logo?) I was told there was a problem with my room, and I'd have to go to another hotel. I was told that the arrangements were already made, and that it was a nice hotel. I almost started to cry, as I had just lugged my bags here from Termini, and I was sad, tired, and just wanted to get into my hotel room, but now I had to walk some place else. Worse yet, I had all my directions mapped from this hotel, and I felt like it would be hard for me to figure it out from another hotel. Someone from Hotel Kennedy offered to walk me to my "new" hotel. He nearly ran though, so I had to run to keep up with him. Running on the uneven cobble stone made me twist my ankle. I screamed in pain. He barely stopped to wait for me while I hobbled along to the other hotel. This was a horrible greeting to Rome! The new hotel wasn't nice, and I felt the whole thing was a bait and switch. I think they gave my room to someone staying longer or paying a higher price. When I arrived in Italy I really didn't have my bearings yet, didn't realize that the street signs are carved into the buildings, etc. It was not a nice way to be greeted into the city. I will never book through Priceline or book the Hotel Kennedy again!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and clean but nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: prescriptiondog
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a five night stay at the Kennedy Hotel in Rome. It was offered as part of a deal with British Airways and ended up being good value for money but nothing more than that. The location is great, almost right next to Termini station and within easy walking distance to the city centre, Republica is 5mins walk, further into the centre approximately 30mins but a reasonable nice walk. Be aware that is very dark around the streets of the hotel at night and you can bump into the odd prostitute as it is near the main trainstation. Also, you can get to the Vatican or other areas easily by underground from Termini Station. The hotel is very clean and good maintained. We were not impressed by the staff, not sure if it is a cultural thing or just not interested in providing the best service to the customer, but we didnt feel welcomed at any point. Answers to our questions where given in a rather abrupt and rude way. I am inclined to put that towards the potential language barrier but most staff seemed fluent in English. The other downside was the breakfast, as it was described as very good in most reviews on here, it didnt offer much that would actually want you to get out of bed in the morning to be honest. If you are looking to have a healthy breakfast, look elsewhere. All on offer were pastries, rolls and a selection of cream cheeses as well as plasterboard like cereals and fruits out of a tin. Overall the breakfast just felt very 'lean and mean' in approach and to me this is one of the key points to get right at a hotel. Not impressed. With regards to the rooms, they were very clean apart from the wall finishes, but the beds felt more like waterbeds, very bouncy and gave me backache in the morning. The final point is noise. Even though we had a 'quiet' room to the rear, the acoustics within the hotel are appalling. The cleaners slammed doors in the morning and guests with kids were screaming throughout the evenings. So if you are looking for a great location, clean and affordable this is a good bet, but if you are looking for a little bit of sleep and a nice breakfast, stay elsewhere! Recommendation to have a nice omelette and coffee in the morning, cheap and local, go to Ristorante Mensa di Bacco also here on tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: matthewjfs
Reviews.Content: I have very recently returned from a 5 night stay at the Kennedy Hotel in rome and felt it very necessary to leave an honest review about this hotel and the experience had by my partner and myself. The kennedy hotel was quite easy to find and close to the rome central train terminal which was very handy as we arrived via train and could walk no more than 5 minutes to the hotel and check in. Check in was fine but i did find the gentleman slightly abrupt, he simply handed me the key and a fist full of maps not personally offering me any information about my room, my breakfast that was included or information on the area which i had come to expect after staying in many 3 star hotels across europe and italy during my vacation. When we located our room we were quite disappointed with what we found. - The room was very run down, there were dozens of black marks all across the walls of the room and across the hotel upon later wandering around the hotel, it was clear that the room and hotel was in need of some serious maintenance. - There was a large black foot print on the ceiling above the bed, as well as numerous black marks and a hole about 5 centimeters in diameter. - The smoke detecter in our room was not working and this was quite concerning to us as you had to dead lock yourself in the room at night with a key just to simply to lock the door, no electronic key which is quite standard these days. - The first night stay in the room was horrible to say the least!! The smell from the air-conditioner which runs through all the rooms of the hotel absolutely stank of cigarette smoke which was foul. We had to sleep with the window open and the air-con turned off just to have some clean air, and unfortunately because of having the window open the noise from the very busy street below kept us awake all night. The following morning we asked the gentleman at the front desk if it was possible to change rooms because of the noise from the street and we were informed that he would "see what he could do". Absolutely nothing came from this request and when we later approached the front desk the following day another gentleman said there was no mention of this request and we could not change rooms. - The television was a tiny 20cm black box that on our first night had 11 viewable channels and by the second night there were 2 with all the rest with a terrible broken signal. Upon leaving the hotel to explore rome we informed front desk of the problem with the television and he assured us that he would look into the problem. Once again it appeared that we were completely ignored as the room and television was undisturbed and we had 2 channels the rest of the stay!! - The Continental breakfast which was included in our room rate was extremely disappointing to say the least! The meal consisted of: - Stale Croissants. - Bread Rolls (with no facilities to toast bread or the rolls, not that any bread was available anyway) - Canned mixed fruit in syrup. - Yoghurt - Cream Cheese and jam - Stale Cakes and coffee. - Cereal In my 4 weeks of touring europe and staying in all 3 star properties this was the only breakfast that was well below standard. On my last day in rome i politely asked the gentleman on front desk if he could please make a phone call on my behalf to confirm a pre booked transfer to the rome airport. The reason i requested this from the gentleman at the front desk was simply because of the italian language barrier. I was ruddily advised that because i had not booked it through the hotel they would not help me and told me to dial "0" from the telephone in my room to make an outside call. The call cost 50 cents as it was only a local call which i would have been more than happy to pay to the gentleman on front desk. Overall my experience at the Kennedy Hotel in rome was appalling. The men on the front desk were extremely rude, arrogant and far from helpful, even the simplest request was ignored or refused. Every other hotel that we stayed in on this trip went above and beyond our expectations of 3 star accommodation except this one. It absolutely fell very short and I would think that it should be a 2 star property. My only positive remark was that it did have clean sheets, towels and the room was always neat and tidy (except for the extreme need for maintenance and a coat of paint). Therefore the only person doing their job within the hotel was the maid. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Good Value For Money !”
Reviews.Author: Marc6711
Reviews.Content: I have stayed recently at Kennedy Hotel during my business trip to Rome and I have to say that I am really surprise with this property. Located just 5 minutes walking from the station, with all luggage, it was very easy to find. Arriving quite late and I wanted something to eat, I didn't have any problem in finding numerous restaurant nearby, one just opposite the hotel. The hotel itself is decorated in a quite exquisite way, reminding me a lot of a charming boutique hotel. Very easy to move around, not far from Via Nazionale, Piazza Della Repubblica e all major monuments within walking distance. Also plenty of shops to buy the usual last minute souvenirs. The staff is very friendly and helpful.It is a family ran business which gives you a sense of staying at home, even thought in a big city like Rome. I was really satisfied with the room I was given, first floor with view to a garden. Drinkable tap water (quite rare in a hotel nowadays). Definitely recommended for both leisure or business travelers. Definitely it is a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: kathy01933
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated near the Termini Station and is therefore accessible to many attractions. The staff are very friendly and helpful and the rooms are fairly clean but in need of refurbishment. Our bed was so hard it was like sleeping on the floor! Breakfast is adequate in quality and plentiful. However, if you look at the website you get the impression that there is a bar (picture of 2 glasses of wine sitting on a bar and the fact that it actually says there IS a bar!!!!). There is not! On our first night we asked where the bar was and we were told that there was a bar down the road or we could go and buy a bottle of wine at the supermarket! VERY misleading! On a different note...make sure you read the prices of food and drink at every restaurant/ cafe in Rome. We didn't on one occasion and were charged 12 euros for 2 cups of coffee! Despite all this our stay in Rome was very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Good to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Cristi_Ionescu
Reviews.Content: Location: The hotel is well located, only 3-4 minutes walking from the Termini Station, which makes an easy transfer from Fiumicino airport. Once arrived, one may have the impression of an unsafe area around the Termini Station especially during the late evenings and nights, but as time goes by you will notice that this is not the case. The area is full of restaurants placing tables outside which means that the area is quite populated until midnight, especially with tourists. Tip: if you need metro line A, then avoid going to Termini as the way to the platforms is a nightmare (lots of modernization works, deviations, crowds of people, etc) – so I would advice going to Vittorio Emmanuele, few blocks behind the hotel. Reception guys: The guys were very friendly, polite and ready to help you with any advice. Don’t be surprised whether they will charge you with an additional 2 euro/ person/night capped at 20 euro/person (i.e. if you stay mote than 10 nights, 20 euro is maximum charge) as per a recently enacted local law, although on my reservation it was clearly stated “all taxes and local charges covered”. This local tax is to help preserving the Roman monuments, museums, etc. Room: The room was at the first floor, being quoted “superior” – was I given it because I stayed 11 nights? Comparing with rooms from other Italian hotels I stayed, this was really modern, large enough. The floor was covered with sand stone, air conditioning worked perfectly, furniture wasn’t too old, TV set was somehow old, but in good shape, as expected no balcony at all. Bathroom was quite ok, in good condition, but no outside window which determined the occurrence of some little mould spots on the ceiling above the shower (no bath). There was hot water all the time. Breakfast: Breakfast was practically the same every morning, rather not diverse, but cannot complain. Milk and cereals, sweets, few fruits and some yellow cheese. Try all coffees they serve, they can prepare it in different ways. All in all, I recommend you this hotel for its strong points (location, room (if you get a superior, cannot comment for the others as I didn’t see them) and price). Have a pleasant stay at Kennedy and …Enjoy Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Short Break in Rome”
Reviews.Author: kbd0949
Reviews.Content: The room and ensuit facility were clean and reasonably equipped for a 3 star hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful and the hotel's location (5 minutes walk from Termini station) made access to transport links and tour buses easy. There are a number of reasonably priced restaurants within walking distance of the hotel however the property is located in a slightly run down and 'shady' area which may be of concern to solo female visitors although - to be fair - no problems were experienced during our visit. On the negative side; the 'continental breakfast' was very basic and the tables within the dining room were so close together that - even for an average size person - transitting between the buffet and table without disturbing fellow diners or guests was difficult.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lori C
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to Termini station. Room was small but this is the norm in Europe - spacious enough for 2 people (double room) - very clean. Very helpful and friendly staff. Breakfast was very good with enough variety. The BEST coffee we've EVER had!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and very close to Termini Station and Metro.”
Reviews.Author: Nautikus
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Kennedy for 3 nights. We found it clean and close to transport. Staff were friendly and helpful and the continental breakfast was adequate. The only frustration would have been the lack of a fridge and an iron. Apparently Italian regulations don't permit them so we can't hold it against them. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: soso1007
Reviews.Content: We were here for 3 days and the hotel is nice. The room was clean, a little bit small but we were not in Rome for staying at the hotel so it was not a problem. The bathroom was very small, we could be in it only one by one. The personal is very gentle, they make great efforts to speak french or english. We were with our car and the hotel negotiates a price in the neighbor parking (13€ per day). The only bad point is the breakfast. There is not much choice and the coffee tastes bad (unusual in Italy).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff, easy to get around”
Reviews.Author: Bo020871
Reviews.Content: My husband and i took our daughter on a three night break to Rome and have just returned home. Unfortunately while we were there my husband became poorly and needed to see a doctor fairly urgently. The staff at the hotel were fantastic in their efforts to help us. They made him an appointment with a local doctor and showed us where to go. We always found the staff to be pleasant, friendly and helpful at all times. The room we had was fine but unfortunately our bed was far too hard and very uncomfortable. Breakfast was adequate. The hotel is a 2 minute walk from Termini where we bought tickets for the hop on and off sightseeing bus. We found this a great way of getting around. At no time did we ever feel unsafe! There is a small restaurant opposite the hotel which serves fairly cheap food and wine. The food was tasty and the service excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. OK for a short stay.”
Reviews.Author: HappyPengu
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at the travel agents prior to arriving in Rome because of its location - a 2 minute walk from Termini Station - and didn't check the reviews prior. The hotel itself is nice and the room is basic yet adequate. Only thing was, our room had a leaking air-conditioning unit that continued to leak throughout our stay. We used the hotel towels to soak up the puddle and despite the daily house-keeping, nothing was done to fix it. We didn't want to kick up a fuss so we left it as it is. Breakfast was adequate - a good choice of cakes, bread, yoghurt, juices and made-to-order coffee. Staff was relatively (not overly) friendly. Overall, it's a good place to stay if you're there for a short trip or a stop-over and need a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel for our one-night stop-over”
Reviews.Author: DinkyJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a one night trip to Rome during our fortnight in Sorrento. We chose the hotel partly due to its convenient location for the railway station and that we could leave our bags at the hotel after check-out rather than carrying them around, sightseeing. We arrived at midday and were delighted that our rooms were already prepared for us. We'd booked a family room some months before, but on arrival were told that they'd run out of family rooms. Instead we were given two double rooms next to each other in a corner of the hotel (122 and 124). As our son is 12, that wasn't a problem. Our double room was very large, while the other was very small, with the double bed against one wall, and the chair and desk squeezed in at the foot of the bed. Air-conditioning worked well and our rooms faced the back of the hotel, so were quiet if we chose to open the windows instead. The beds were comfortable and we all had a good night's sleep. The bathrooms were very small (how anyone overweight could sit on the toilet, I don't know!) and I wasn't totally confident about their cleanliness, although it may just have been that they were in need of refurbishment. Can recommend the atmospheric Gallo Matto Italian restaurant just 5 minute walk away for a lovely, and inexpensive, Italian evening meal. Breakfast wasn't up to much at the Kennedy. Coffee was nice. There was a small choice of cereals, plus some coissants. The only fruit was some apples and oranges, and there were some yogurts. We'd been enjoying the cold buffet breakfasts in our hotel in Sorrento, but this was not a patch on the breakfasts there and we were glad we were staying just the one night.

Reviews.Title: “Well located”
Reviews.Author: Joel205
Reviews.Content: Close to train station and transport. We had a room on the top floor, very clean and well appointed except there was no safe to lock up our valuables. Breakfast is very basic and is served by reception and house keeping staff but the coffee is good. Lift is slow and had to use the stairs quite a bit.

Reviews.Title: “convinient for railway station”
Reviews.Author: Akatea
Reviews.Content: very close to the railway station which was great when first arriving. A bit too far from the centre of the city. The service was pleasant and helpful. Great breakfast. Would have like a mini frig as it was very hot and no where to get a cold drink, the hotel frig was not operating. disappointing that internet was not free.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Jackal2112
Reviews.Content: Cheap hotel, wouldn't peg it as 3*, more of a 2*... Great location, in easy reach of all the main sights and places of interest. Easy to find and only 4-5 mins walk from Termini Station. Friendly staff, who spoke good English and were happy to assist with maps, booking tours and giving directions etc. The room was clean and reasonably sized, with large wardrobe, tv and trouser press. The daily fresh bedlinens and towels were a bonus. The bathroom did let it down; not especially clean and with black grouting round the tiles, it also boasted temperamental water pressure and intermittent hot / cold water in the shower, so not great really. The breakfast was dire. You could eat your fill, as there was plenty available and the trays of rolls were constantly being refilled, but there was a comnplete lack of choice and the food was very bland. Bread rolls, tinned fruit or cereal, served with watered-down orange juice and / or weak and tasteless coffees. In a country famed for its good food, it was disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: Sue697
Reviews.Content: First impression as we walked down the street to the hotel was what have we done!The area is scruffy and I wouldn't want to be walking the area after 10pm.We were put into room 104 not the best room I have stayed in,the pillows and matress were like sleeping on the floor. first impression was depressing. The view was of a wall and I have no idea what all the pipes were for, maybe something to do with the air conditioning. The TV reception was poor we did tell reception but nothing was done about it .There wasn't a phone in the room.The dining room was cramped the breakfast was ok.It is very convenient for the train station which is full of pickpockets and people wanting to help you but then asking for money . .I wouldn't recomend this hotel and I wouldn't stay there again.Most of the information given about this hotel is misleading ,the Trevi fountain and Spanish steps are not close ,the station is close and the open air bus that takes you around the main tourist sites at a price !!

Reviews.Title: “Total let down”
Reviews.Author: parmjit1966
Reviews.Content: we were greet by a friendly guy in reception who was friendly, helpful couldn't do for enough for . The following 2 days we greet by the most miserable unhelpful inpatient reception person i have ever met. Once we got back home i did e-mail the hotel and the response was not good , there was no apology . i won't be going back to Kennedy hotel or recommending to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - great base for seeing Rome”
Reviews.Author: roses095
Reviews.Content: We had a superior twin bed room which was not huge but more than big enough. The room was clean and tidy with TV and air conditioning. The bathroom was good - very clean with fresh towels daily - nice to use. Only complaint was the view from the window which was onto a roof top- but we were not in the room long enough to really be that bothered. The breakfast was assorted cereals, rolls, spreads, yogurts and fruit. Not a banquet but more than enough to start the day and keep you going. Plenty of restaurants near and 2 mins. from the trains and buses. For a 3 star hotel it was good value and we would go back.

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL FOR LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: gogreen1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Kennedy for 2 nights while in Rome. We had a nice experience with the hotel, rooms we clean and well kept, breakfast was good. I received an email from the hotel about 2 weeks before arrival regarding a pickup at the airport, which we took (60 euros for 4 of us including luggage door to door. Hotel was in a safe area and walking distance to many sights. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Be warned - it's a dump”
Reviews.Author: LisaW2011
Reviews.Content: I prebooked this hotel for 4 nights, pre and post a leisure cruise. We were so unimpressed with the first 2 nights we did not want to return post-cruise, but unfortunately we had pre-paid so would not have received a refund, and therefore had little choice. Apart from one staff member, all the reception staff were unfriendly to the point of being arrogantly rude. Breakfast sub standard, and bathrooms so small and dated you could barely close the shower door - that is when you actually got into the shower once you climbed over the bidet which blocked the shower entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer0
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Kennedy Hotel over East weekend this year, and thoroughly enjoyed the experience.It is a standard bed and breakfast and the prices reflect this. But the rooms were spacious enough for 2 people and suitcases with lots of storage space and hangers 3 nights, the bed very large and comfy and the bathroom was clean. Breakfast was a basic continental breakfast, but with all the amazing places to eat in Rome it was certainly plenty to keep you going till lunch time. The staff were friendly, offered a place to keep luggage before and after check in/out and provided good maps of the city. The best thing is the location, it is very close to the main station (5 min walk max) and so is very easy to get around Rome and to/from the airport. The only bad thing I would say about this hotel was that in our room (number 16) you could hear some dustbin lorries moving bins around in the morning when we slept with the windows open. Other than that is was perfect for a short city break that doesn't break the bank!

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Barbaram11
Reviews.Content: Recently we were going through Rome and our travel agent booked this hotel for us.. What a horible experience. a) The hotel carpets are old, worn out and FILTHY with huge ugly stains. b) The bathroom shower head was clogged with BLACK ugly mold and the same black mold was growing on the bathroom walls. c) Our "superior" room was smal cramped and overlooking the rubbish dumpsters outside. d) Breakfast was a few sweet pastries, some soft cheese, and couple of cereals, that we had to eat ether out of PLASTIC dirty bawls,(YES, PLASTIC GREEN ) or out of the last old prehistoric chipped porcelane one.. e) The internet connection kept dropping out, and we had to pay more and more money for it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location to visit Rome,”
Reviews.Author: HayleyMic
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Kennedy ticked all the boxes. It was central , parallel to Termini station, had good amenities close by and was clean. You do get what you pay for but for what you pay it is perfect, there were no complaints from us. Breakfast was Cereals, rolls, croissants, cheese, jam, biscuits with tea/coffee and juice - so worth the little extra to get your day started. Also if you are looking for a cheap transfer from airport use 'Terravision.com'. Our transfer was £4 each way. Direct from Airport to Termini Station. Much cheaper option than taxi/transfer. They also do transfers in London too. I went for a long weekend and travelled around using the Rome Tour Bus. Which the first stop is opposite the bus station at Termini. It brings you to all the main sites of interest although a couple, Trevi Fountain and Spanish steps, you have to search out for yourself. But Trevi Fountain is so beautiful and so worth searching for. Used website Viator.com to book promo tours, meal discounts. Very useful for any trip away!!

Reviews.Title: “close to the metro, convenient and pleasant enough”
Reviews.Author: stephenandmichelle
Reviews.Content: close to the metro, ideal for sight-seeing - rome is wonderful and the kennedy is a great base. As we were literally only there as a base, we didnt have enough time to take in the hotel, staff's customer service left a little to be desired however and the breakfast wasn't up to much. but for a cheap and cheerful place to use as a base, the hotel is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Handy location to transport and sights”
Reviews.Author: kerryandnoel
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights in early October 10, and found the location a help for its proximity to Termini Station. Variety of dining available nearby and an excellent breakfast at the hotel. The rooms were small but adequate. A little cramped when there is a reasonable amount of luggage. The staff were friendly and always helpful. The hotel was compact, but neat and tidy.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: KateNYC25
Reviews.Content: The staff are incredibly rude. Never have I been insulted and belittled by anyone, much less service staff, anywhere in my travels across the globe. The area around the hotel is not pleasant, and the hotel itself is barely an upgrade from a hostel. Not a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation in Rome”
Reviews.Author: lisogegon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is average with good rooms and cleaning service. Perfect location near Termini. Very good breakfast buffet - nothing missing even for a hungry man. Missing possibility of a fresh cup of coffee in the evening - f.i. an automatic coffee machine. Had problems with Internet access while staying and preferred to go to the nearest Internet shop just around the corner near Termini.

Reviews.Title: “good, convenient, great location”
Reviews.Author: auntjudy325
Reviews.Content: The hotel was more than adequate. We got there early but they switched a room and make it ready for us immediately. All the staff was helpful. Located near train station. Just beware, took taxi from train station and was taken. Charged me double because I was picked up at station. I tried to take license number but he ran off. My fault. Should have called police. Oh well. Hotel was still great, cheap, plenty of restaurants within walking distance. Even some beautiful churches within a few blocks. Would stay there again. Oh yes, room was cleaned beautifully every day. Forgot, it had breakfast also. More than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Economical, very very close to Termini Station......”
Reviews.Author: GregoryOrangeCounty
Reviews.Content: This hotel can't be more than a block from Termini Station making it very convienent for the train to everywhere in Italy and the subway. The rooms are clean. The price was reasonable. The front desk was helpful with dinner reservations and arranging a car to the airport. Breakfast was included.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but reasonably clean.”
Reviews.Author: Jennyj_blue
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Kennedy for two nights in a twin room. The room was pretty basic, but we didn't spend much time there...just slept. A neighbouring guest had his/her TV turned up loud, and this did bother us for a while one night. I found it odd that we couldn't open the curtains, only the whole window, in order to let light into the room (not that the view was remarkable). Airconditioning was effective, and we certainly appreciated it. TV didn't work, but that didn't bother us. It might have been entertaining to catch a bit of Italian TV, but it wasn't why we were there. Desk staff were mostly friendly and helpful. Location is close to Stazione Termini, the most central railway station...and this was terrific. We were able to get around Rome easily. We had the buffet breakfast on Day Two. It was pretty good...wide choice of cereals, bread, pastries, drinks. I was disappointed with the coffee served, however...tasted like instant....specifically like Moccona brand (Australians may know this brand). Plenty to eat, however.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if you're on a tight budget”
Reviews.Author: kiekske
Reviews.Content: I had read some very good and some very bad reviews on this hotel, so I was curieus what we would find. At first sight the room looked great, but after taking a closer look the room was decrepit. There was no safe nor fridge. So unfortunatly it was impossible to cool your drinks. The bathroom was very small. I even think that larger or heavier people are not able to get in the shower. On the other hand, the rooms were very clean and the staff was friendly. We saw a couple asking for directions and they got a very friendly answer. The staff also didn't mind to repeat the answer several times. We also had a nice view on the park next door. The location is a bit harder. It comes in very handy to be so close to the station and the metro and the center of Rome was easy to reach on foot. But at the evenings I didn't feel safe on the streets outside the hotel, so we had to go back to our hotel before dark. Conclusion: If you're on a tight budget, I would recommend this hotel. If you have a bit more money to spend I would look for an other hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Abusive Staff, No Customer Service, Broken Elevator, Horrible”
Reviews.Author: SteveG213
Reviews.Content: Immediately after check-in, we got on the small, hot elevator, on the way up, the elevator stopped, the lights went out, and the fan turned off. We were stuck inside. we were informed that we would have to wait until a tech arrived to open the door, in about 30 mins.! So, with no air, light, or connection to the world, we waited. Finally after 45 mins, they managed to get the door open and we got out. They said this sortof thing happens all the time. I demanded some sort of compensation or anything. They didn't even offer us a glass of water or OJ, let alone a free room, or even breakfast or a bottle of wine. When my wife talked to the front desk in tears, they told her to stop crying like a baby, and "her tears are pathetic". She was truely scared after the elevator experience. We still managed to have a great time in Rome, but God help us and you if you ever stay at this place. Also, the showers are small, there is no view, and our skin was itchy from the sheets when we woke up, and we had been in 7 other countries/hotels before this with no issues! Awful place.

Reviews.Title: “OMG Stay away from this place!!!”
Reviews.Author: CAhern
Reviews.Content: A/C not able to cool room [Had to empty the drip bucket]. No Internet -- advertised saying that there was Mattress was as thin as can be Woke up with unidentified bites on legs Bad neighborhood Won't work with us to refund the prepaid fees that we had paid for dates of service as we quickly checked out and went to another place.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE,”
Reviews.Author: UkAwayfromhome
Reviews.Content: unless you enjoy stale bread, pre-packed croissants and tinned fruit for breakfast. Ok when we booked we knew that we were near the Termini station and to be honest the llocation is not too bad. The beds were terrible, lumpy and uncomfortable, the first room that we were shown the mattress smelt of urine so we got a move to a superior room on the 5th floor. It was superior compared to the initial room but it was not what you would really expect if you paid the hotel rack rate of €230 per night. In a city full of bars/cafes where fresh bread etc is the norm it is an absolute scandal that the bread rols were stale, the heating of them did not hide how old they were, the croissants were unwrapped from cling flim by an old guy who sneezed on his hands and the cheese and fruit were disgusting. this place is a joke and should be taken off the BA list. please do not expect a god time here.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel : Value for money”
Reviews.Author: BDM007
Reviews.Content: The location close to Termini-station is a big advantage You are walking distance from main station so it is very quick and easy catch a train, bus or use the sub-way. There are a few restaurants in the street which serve a good meal for a affordable price. The staff is very kind and helpful. Breakfast is good and the superior rooms on the 5th floor are very clean and comfortable. We really enjoyed our stay here and would book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic”
Reviews.Author: davemaxDerby
Reviews.Content: This is not a Hotel. This is a B&B. The rooms are clean and adequate although there was no safe to store valuables.There is a wardrobe but nowhere to put other items unless you put them all on your bedside table or next to the TV. The bathroom was clean and you were provided with basis toiletries. Towels were changed daily and the Housekeeping staff were polite. I was able to get hair dryer upon request. The place is being refurbished, the reception area is small but does it job. As so many others have said, you have to lug your luggage up a small set of stairs before getting to reception. The carpet on the staircase is filthy and very worn. The Hotel is recommended by British Airways as having a bar and the Hotel's literature states it has a bar - it even goes as far as providing a picture of 2 glasses of wine next to a bucket of ice with wine in it - however, when I asked at reception where the bar was I was told there wasnt one. I told the receptionist that it clearly states in the Hotels literature that there is a bar, I even showed him the picture in their own literature - only to be growled at and told "only the breakfast bar !" The area it was located in was ok, we didn't stay out late at night, but I can imagine that it may feel a bit daunting to be walking around late at night so near the train station - which even during the day feels a touch intimidating. On a more positive note, it is easy to get to everywhere from here. Breakfast was held in 3 very small rooms, you sat so close to your fellow travellers - you could have been forgiven for thinking you were on holiday with them. ! Breakfast choice consisted of a bowl of fruit cocktail,croissants, breads, and a choice of very sweet cakes, although the coffee was welcomed. Would I stay here again - NO, most definately not, it is definately not a Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well situated, pleasant staff..”
Reviews.Author: paolobrags
Reviews.Content: We had the superior room and it was clean, and the bed was very confortable. The hotel is well situated and within walking distance of the main attractions. The Termini station is round the corner and like near any station it is the nicest of areas but we had no problems walking around late at night.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel for a good price”
Reviews.Author: dyszki
Reviews.Content: Nice service,good breakfast and clean room. The location- close to Termini. It has it's pros and cons. You are walking distance from main station but on the other hand the surrounding is not very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “3 star excellence”
Reviews.Author: jeepee
Reviews.Content: Kennedy Hotel is all you would expect of a 3 star european Hotel. The Rooms were clean,comfortable and well serviced.We had clean towels every day and the usual bathroom condiments were topped up every day. The air conditioner was not very good but at this time of year,February,we did not need it .The Decor is well thought out and spotlessly clean. The Staff are very helpfull and Friendly.The Breakfast ,while plain and what you would expect of a continental breakfast was plentiful.eat as much as you like. The general area appears to be a little scruffy and as you might expect being close to a city railway station but we had no trouble at all and felt quite safe arriving back at the Hotel in the evening. Close to Busses and the Metro (termini railway station) everywhere in Rome is so easily accessable. Many of the places well within walking distance. My one negative point is the noise of the Metro as it passes almost under the Hotel.But this stops at around 11pm anyway. The rooms are relatively soundproof being both double glazed and shuttered and cosidering the city location is reasonably quiet. I would not hessitate in recomending this hotel for a city break and will in all probability stay there again if I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: seattravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Kennedy in early December 2009. We have 3 children ranging from13 years through to 7 years. The hotel staff where very friendly and able to answer the many questions we asked them. The rooms where comfortable clean and well appointed. The hotel was well situated close to termini and in walking distance of many of the major attractions. The breakfast in the hotel was fresh and delicious with ample to get you started. In a city where to get the best out of it you need to walk coming back to the Hotel Kennedy was a welcome relief. I would recommend the Hotel Kennedy to anybody wanting a comfortable and conveninet stay with knwoledgable and friendly staff while in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, good value, great location.”
Reviews.Author: gubik
Reviews.Content: I was pleased with Hotel Kennedy. They were very nice at the front desk and can manage english. The rooms are of course small, but clean. Our bed was two twins pushed together but, it was fine. I know it's silly, but I liked the bathroom a lot! And not just because of the bidet. I really enjoyed breakfast and it was included. The area can be a little sketchy late at night, but so is a lot of Rome, like any major city. It's very close to the main train station, tour bus station, and airport shuttle bus stop. We're walkers and actually walked to and from the main sights. I was really pleased with the value. Good place to lay your head at night while in an amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “Location and that's all”
Reviews.Author: lajty
Reviews.Content: I have just arrived with my wife from Rome and have to say couple of words about hotel Kennedy.First of all,the location is really great as we were only 5 min far away from Termini,but other things were not so good.Our main complainments are for bathroom and breakfast.Shower cabin was so small that you couldn't use shower normaly (with my 186 cm of height I was forced to open cabin door each time I was suposed to wash my legs) and the second thing was that you coudn't seat normally on a toilet seat (my head was in a shower cabin during sitting believe me or not and my legs were in some sphynx position).Speaking about breakfast I have never seen im my whole life a buffet without any meat product!!!Not a single salamy or something like that,there was only food for vegetarians. Luckely,Rome itself is an amazing city so you would forget about this problems very soon and you will take home only great memories!

Reviews.Title: “The Kennedy hotel was OK but”
Reviews.Author: raff79
Reviews.Content: The Kennedy hotel was ok but the area around hotel is not very safe place after sunset, you have to be very alert when going back to the hotel at night .

Reviews.Title: “Great location to be close to all transport”
Reviews.Author: travellingMr-MrsM
Reviews.Content: The Kennedy was a great location close to the Termini Train station and all the buses. Very easy to find as long as you walk out the very front of the Termini station a little harder if you walk out another door. There are small deli type supermarkets close by and several very very good resturants within 3 blocks. The general area looks a little shady but it is a reasonablly safe place to walk around even at night. The rooms are clean and tidy with the superior rooms having a great bathroom with bath tub, TV, and plenty of room for suitcases. Only down point with the rooms are the windows they only open so far and don't let in alot of fresh air (this is mainly for security). And if staying there between the 1st October and March there is NO airconditioning in the rooms so it can get quite hot and stuffy. The continental breakfast you get with your room is basic but very tasty and fresh with made to order coffee and tea.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon night from hell”
Reviews.Author: rattled
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Rome after 23 hours of flying from Australia with two tranfers.When we entered the room my new wife broke into tears immediately.3 stars in Italy is in no way comparable to 3 stars in Australia. Bed appeared to be two single bases pushed together but i was not game to check because if i pulled back the sheets and it was dirty I think my wife may have stabbed me. Toilet would not flush unless I was prepared to dunk my hand in the cistern and the shower with broken tiles and mould leaked completley flooding the bathroom. TV would not turn on but i dont think i would have been able to see the tiny little thing from the bed anyway.Not the way i was planning on spending my honeymoon. I walked the streets trying to find a better hotel but it appears this is what you get for your money and 3 Stars in Rome. Staff were friendly enough but we were dreading returning to the room for 3 days after our 12 day cruise. A different room on our return was no better and i missed our tiny room on the ship with no window.Both rooms we had were very noisy with street noise. I would suggest for anybody looking for a nice room in Rome to shop around (don't believe the pictures on the internet), ask for modern rooms and to go at least 4 Stars.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Cool,Thats where it Starts and Ends”
Reviews.Author: amcuryo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this Hotel in August. The room was very clean and cool, however there are no power points to charge your mobil phone and when staff were asked as( advised to do so in the room)to what to do we were advised to go to a phone shop at Termini, however they wouldnt help us either.This is 2009 not 1989, most people these days have a mobil phone and phones need charging.As an agent had booked this hotel, on our return I advised them of the inconvience. Yes it was good and central to the termini and metro but that was about it. Breakfast was only just accepteable and I found the staff to be not very helpful.The rooms were clean and spacious but very basic I wouldnt recommend this hotel to any of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “website flatters it - reality different”
Reviews.Author: roma55
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights, supposedly refurbished recently. Our room clean but not refurbed (except in the1980's). Tiles cracked in bathroom, hole in ceiling covered with paper and taped. Beds hard. Certainly no marble and parquet flooring in our room! No lounge / bar area so only had bedroom to sit in and relax. Breakfast very basic, very cramped rooms (which were obviously original lounge area). Felt that you were only offered minimum they could get away with. Certainly could not have a relaxing breakfast. Reception area very scruffy though a taped notice apologised and said it was going to be refurbed! Don't know if hotel has recently changed hands but it was very disappointing and nothing like website.

Reviews.Title: “A very basic hotel. I expected more.”
Reviews.Author: Deffe
Reviews.Content: I booked a double room at the Kennedy Hotel in september 2009 since I expected it would be convenient to travel in Rome with all the train and metro connections available at the nearby Termini train station. I must admit, its location has its advantages: after hopping off the Leonardo Express from Fiumicino, it's a very short walk to get to the hotel. You'll be able to check right in, take the elevator and jump right into bed should you want to. Another advantage is the nearby Conad supermarket, open from 6 AM untill midnight. It's a basic european supermarket, enabling you to buy decent food at a decent price. The rooms at the Kennedy are very basic, however. The bathroom in 201 was very tiny, and could have used a few extra square meters for comfort. The bed was okay, and a closet with two shelves at the bottom was provided. Rome can get very hot in the summers, so luckily air conditioning is provided. For those interested: the TV offers CNN, BBC World and a variety of Italian channels. There are no extra services at the hotel, no bar you can sit at, gym or sauna. There's a small waiting room at the back of the reception desk, but it's not very inviting and not very comfortable. The breakfast is downright awful. Seriously, skip breakfast and eat it somewhere else. As for the idea that being close to Termini is a good thing due to all the transport connections: it's a plus, but merely a tiny one. Rome isn't that big. What looked like a huge walk on the map is only a fifteen minute stroll (for example: walking from colosseo to the Victor Emanuelle II monument). Also, Rome only has 2 metro lines, A and B (with C under construction). Sights like Piazza Navona and the Pantheon aren't anywhere near a metro stop. I seriously recommend taking the bus - busses are included in your metro ticket. The transportation advantage is only minor. My next visit in Rome will be in a more romantic area, in the center of Rome and probably not near Termini. Not that it's an unsafe or unpleasant neighbourhood, it's just not really an advantage over other options. The overall feeling I had was that this the Kennedy Hotel could be so much more. I expected more for the price I payed. It's not a bad hotel, but it's not a good one either. You could probably find better hotels for the same price in the beautiful city centre of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “it was such a relief during a hot summer to arrive at this serene and airconditioned hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: fenellak
Reviews.Content: Excellent location: walking distance to train station clean and spacious rooms airconditioned which was so good in hot summer very nice breakfast well organised with daily room service, telephone and en suite above all, very polite and helpful staff. When we left numerous things behind they took the time to mail them to us in Australia which was much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Only for location”
Reviews.Author: NewZealandLee09
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights because it's included in our air fares. The hotel's location was very good as it's very close to the main train station and the bed was fairly clean. However apart from these, we won't recommend this hotel. The staffs at the front desk were rude and unhelpful if you didn't give tips for every question. The shower door was broken and the shower was blocked. We travelled in early May which wasn't so hot. So we had no idea if the air conditioner could work or not.

Reviews.Title: “rude staff and grimy bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: kellycrystal
Reviews.Content: I would only recommend this hotel if you needed a cheap place to sleep at night before catching a train a Termini. Other than that, go somewhere else. NEGATIVES: • The front desk staff was always rude. One day the cleaning lady took our dirty towels, but forgot to give us clean ones. We saw this when we stopped in at 4:00 and asked for towels on our way out to sight see and were told we would have some when we got back. When we returned at 9:00, we still didn't have any and the guy at the desk acted like I was rude for asking for them and said he couldn't help me this late at night and I had to wait until tomorrow. We finally thought to ask if we could get some from an unoccupied room, so he rudely said we could and had my husband go down and get a key and get the towels himself. • Another day we asked a front desk guy how to get to a popular tourist sight. He indifferently said I should go to the tourist information place 5 blocks away and ask them. • The bathroom was grimy and a bit gross. • The neighborhood was shady - If you walked away from Termini Station towards all the sights it was dirty and ugly. And someone tried to pick pocket my husband two blocks from the hotel when we were walking back at night. There are some many pretty places to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean hotel near Termini station”
Reviews.Author: Sommaren09
Reviews.Content: We would recommend this hotel because it´s a small nice hotel, very well situated near the central station. Many times we took the metro from the Termini station to different places worth seeeing. The hotel was also easy to reach at arrival and easy to leave going home by bus to the airport. The room, a superior room, was enough for the two of us and very well cleaned every day. The breakfast was also proportionately OK. We had a very nice visit, 4 days, in Rome and hope to come back and experience more of everything worth seeing. Mikael och Suzanne from Linköping Sweden

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: brendan01
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Kennedy hotel in may , the staff were helpful, the rooms were clean and so was bathroom . i cant`understand any one criticizing this hotel. If your looking for a cheap beer or two your best bet is to go the back of the hotel where the monument is walk past it then turn right ,on the right hand side of the street their is a Chinese restaurant next door is the bar they don't speak much English, but the beers good.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and staff, convenient location, has it all”
Reviews.Author: dlanods
Reviews.Content: We have travelled a fair bit in Europe for a couple from Australia and this is the only hotel we fell in love with. Very convenient to the train station where we arrived, the staff were only to happy to help us with any questions we had as first-time visitors to Rome. The room was beautiful, spacious and comfortable, and the breakfast was plentiful. Given we were travelling on a budget, finding a gem like this within our price range blew us away.

Reviews.Title: “We were SO put off!”
Reviews.Author: BellaVeronica
Reviews.Content: We booked the Kennedy Hotel as it was one recommeded by BA Travel when we booked our flight to Rome. We spent 3 nights at the end of January 2008 at the 4 star Rose Garden Hotel off the Via Venneta.....we couldn't wait to get back to Rome we loved it so much, so I booked 4 nights at the Kennedy. Five minutes from the station, convenient for travel but a truly dirty, tacky place! No one seems to have mentioned that it is in the middle of a weird sort of 'China Town'! Strange, useless shops, dirty smelly bins all over the place, which are filled and emptied at all times of the day and night. Dog mess everywhere The Hotel claims to be 3 star.....NO WAY, to have hairdryers in all rooms, there wasn't in ours, no fridge, no air con, switched off for winter, although it was 1st October and 26+ degrees. We could use the safe at the reception, not free as stated but 5 euros. The bathroom was diabolicle 4x6 feet is probably being generous....crammed with a toilet, bidet, sink and shower...couldn't bend over in the shower, no room and nowhere to put anything....the plugs in the bidet and sink didn't work so you had to keep the taps running to have enough water to wash in. Being of 'ample' size, I found the bathroom unpleasant to use. The room was furnished with plain cheap furniture that I wouldn't have in my shed! The bed was okay but kept sliding away from the wall, and my pillows smelled smokey through my pillow case. The room was bad enough, but breakfast????? The coffee was okay, but served in lidless jugs so that it was cold in seconds. The orange juice was some reconstituted stuff which we couldn't drink, the milk was long life the cerials were 'disgusting', cheap and nasty which we couldn't eat. That left chunks of dry bread, croissants, dry cakes and tarts, packets of dry crackers, cake or french toast, mostly broken and a basket of little tubs of jam or honey of which they were proud enough to announce it on there board out the front.....'11 types of jam'.....by the 2nd morning I didn't even want to go to breakfast anymore. This experience had completely turned my way of thinking around from our first trip to Rome, I never want to go to Italy again! Think carefully before you book the Kennedy and if you can afford it, go more up market.

Reviews.Title: “excellent budget hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rainyday4
Reviews.Content: My sister and I have just returned from a great weekend stay at this hotel. After reading some of the poorer reviews we decided to take a chance and we were pleasantly surprised. We paid about 80 pounds a night and found that the hotel was far above average. It is just a few minutes walk from the station, the area is a bit run down but we did not feel unsafe, the area is bustling and lively, full of tourists and restaurants. The staff were all English speaking, polite and welcoming, the room was a good size , very quiet and the bathroom was spotless. Breakfast was continental but plentiful including cereals, fresh fruit, cheese, pastries and hot croissants. We ate dinner at the restaurant opposite which was excellent value for money. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a nice clean hotel for a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: aotearoanz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in a good area for sightseeing as it is less than five minutes walk to the Termini in Rome and from here you can catch the Metro, Buses or Trains to anywhere. Other than that the area is a bit seedy and over run with people trying to sell you all kinds of junk. There are a number of "tourist" restaurants handy if you are in a hurry otherwise there are better and less expensive restaurants a bit further away. The room is not overly big, but was comfortable and clean. The bathroom was clean and roomy. The staff could speak and understand English and were helpful with directions and questions. The breakfast is a typical continental and was adequate but we found if you arrived a little later than 8.00am there was not a lot left. The hotel is good value if you just want somewhere to sleep for a few nights. Internet access is available in the sitting room if you have a laptop as they do not provide computers.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe what you see.”
Reviews.Content: Rome was the final leg of a European vacation and decided to stay at a better hotel. Or so I thought. After seeing the photos on the hotel's website, I booked a 3 night stay. When I got there with my wife, the hotel room was NOTHING like what was shown on the website. The hotel claims rooms were renovated recently, they sure fooled me. The bed was HORRIBLE. The center of the matress was sagging as there was no box spring and it felt like we were sleeping on sofa bed. The walls looked dirty and the light fixtures were tacky. It was nice that breakfast was included, but how much pre-packaged croissants and cereal can you eat. All in all, don't believe the photos on the hotel's website. Spend a little more and stay at the 4* hotel that's about a 100 ft down the street. One additional note. VERY close to Roma Termini and the restaurant (Ristronte de Giuseppe) directly across the street from the front door is excellent for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Aceroony
Reviews.Content: We kicked off our Europe trip in Rome and had a great time staying at the Kennedy Hotel! Staff was friendly, room was nice - furniture was not new but very sufficient. Location was excellent! Very close to major train terminal and so many great restaurants to walk to for dinner! Great town, great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Caffe, but .....”
Reviews.Author: AngeNE
Reviews.Content: First, I have to say that it was raining most of our visit.Very hard city to visit in the rain, when you need to be outside to see the sights.Hotel Kennedy was a rough start to a holiday.First, staff not friendly.Even a bit sour and unapproachable.Breakfast was very nice. Great choices for food and the coffee was fab!Though it would have been nice to know not to go into the coffee makers room to get a coffee..he was a bit testy.Room was small, but typical. Clean space.Phone was not working, mainly cause one in bathroom was not shut off, so using phone was impossible.View of dumpster and noise from dumpster not great, but the wildest thing was all the men using the dumpster to pee on. Location to train station was great and had the front row view to a ruin cross the street. Guess you get what you pay for!!

Reviews.Title: “Very average”
Reviews.Author: sheri15
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kennedy Hotel as it was part of a flights package through our travel agent. I wasn't expecting much after reading the reviews and so my expectations were low. The front desk were friendly and the breakfast was very good. However, after 2 months travelling around Europe, the walls at the Hotel Kennedy were by far the thinnest we encountered. The next room sounded like they were in our room. We had 3 men arrive back at 1am drunk and talking very loudly. We rang reception and they did ring to ask them to be quiet twice which was good, but they didn't stop. The bathroom was very small and the air conditioning wasn't very cold. Good location by the Termini

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing start to our holiday”
Reviews.Author: Beckert
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the positives, the staff were welcoming and helpful with information, the location just close to Termini was great and the power shower rocked, although I managed to spray most of the bathroom. Now the rest... my research on hotels in Rome and talking to other people who had been there leaves me with the impression that unless you have pots of cash, hotels in Rome are generally disappointing and really you are out and about most of the day so not hanging about in your room. the rooms were a little small and grim and there were cigarette burns in the bedding. It was pretty noisy with clumping from the guests above and anyone arriving or leaving seemed to echo. There is street noise but hey it's Rome and not the hotels fault. It wasn't awful but could do with a scrub and an update and I am used to getting more bang for my buck at hotels. Probably wouldn't stay there again but if you just wanted somewhere convenient to lay your head that wasn't too exxy I guess this would do.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean budget base to explore from”
Reviews.Author: DamianLiverpool
Reviews.Content: The hotel is approximately 200metres from the main temini, (Both the the A and B routes call at this station) making it an ideal base to explore the numerous sites of Rome. The hotel itself is clean, (although the entrance does look a little tired). However the rooms are cleaned daily, although not all rooms have baths, (only showers) so if you need one, specify at time of booking. Also the hotel is ideally situated just off one of the main roads, meaning that you are spared the majority of the Rome traffic noise. The breakfast for me was the most disappointing aspect, it is described as a full continental breakfast, however a choice of three cereals, one type of croissant, two fruits, two cheeses and one type of bread roll does not make a full breakfast in my opinion. No selection of meats or any imagination in each days offering was my main grumbling point. But this still does not take away from the fact that for what you pay overall this hotel is still good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Good little hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlanandTracey
Reviews.Content: Got upgraded to a superior room at no extra charge. Room was clean and windows opened which was nice at night. Convenient location although not a particularly nice area at night time. Breakfasts were satisfatory and the staff were extremely pleasant. The best restaurant in the street is definitely La Ginestra. The sights in Rome are worth the visit but on the whole it is our least favourite capital city. This is due to the fact that it is extremely expensive and extremely dirty (litter and graffiti everywhere all the time wherever you go). We found the majority of Italians in Rome to be arrogant and rude. It is an extremely busy and noisy city and street pedlars are everywhere which proved to be a nuisance when eating outside at night.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: nzwendy
Reviews.Content: A fanatstic little hotel. We had a superior room overlooking the park eally really nice. Loved it. Staff very fiendly and hepful. huge buffet breakfast. close to termini but also walkable to all sites!

Reviews.Title: “One Word...Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: sljordan85
Reviews.Content: We went to Rome for my 21st and we stayed at Hotel Kennedy. Its 2 minutes from the train/metro station. Very handy for when you are trying to get places in Rome. Our room had a view of a historical monument and was really nice. The room was spaceous and clean. The bathroom had a walk in power shower and was the best, with a hairdryer built in. They have kept to the theme of Rome, our room had sea shell lights, mosiacs and paintings and had a lovely roman feeling. The bed was mega comfy. we had a wardrobe each built in, TV with all the channels, table, chairs and air con. The breakfast was the continental style of warm fresh bread cheeses meats yogurt and very wierd but how lovely, slices of cheese cake and chocolate cake! with steam cream coffee and fresh pots of tea brought to the table. I cannot fault the hotel one bit. The staff were polite and if we wanted room service they came in a flash even at midnight when we fancied a bottle of wine! The breakfast was great with plenty of choice and spotless rooms its a must stay place at only £50 a night its perfect for a romantic getaway. Rome is the most amazing place i have EVER been and i would recommend going to Rome for a long weekend to ANY couple!!!! The coloseum at night it just breath taking!

Reviews.Title: “Great! Wanna budget hotel? Stay at the Kennedy! Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: TiddyEngland
Reviews.Content: The Kennedy Hotel is perfect for a short break to Rome. Clean, friendly and in a good location for staying in Rome without paying through the nose. Yes..the rooms aren't massive but how much room do you need? There is ample room! We arrived late and having read a previous review mentioning about eating just over the road at 'Guiseppes' we wasted no time in going there and we weren't dissapointed! Put it this way...we went back 3 nights running! Jimmy & Ruby will make you very welcome! Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: 01206wilf
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are in our sixties.We stayed at The Kennedy for 7 nights.The hotel is just a five minute walk from the railway station which is only a 30 minute train ride from the airport and of course is also handy for days out using the metro,trains or buses.We could not fault the hotel or its staff on one thing.We walked to all the attractions from the hotel (we are very fit ) but it's to be reccomended as you see so much more and the local map from reception has all the roads marked, unlike many city maps.Our room was spotless, the staff were friendly and very helpful, the buffet breakfast was a most pleasant and filling way to start the day and gave you a chance chat with your fellow guests and we will most certainly use this hotel on our next visit to Rome.Please don't think that the hotel is best suited to people of a certain age as all ages and many different countries were represented while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Not to experience again”
Reviews.Author: Tony1956
Reviews.Content: The room was as wide as a corridor with the twin beds and cupboard running along the wall due to the room being so narrow. The bathroom was the tiniest I have ever seen. Unfortunately, the breakfast was just as bad. The only up side was that the staff on the desk were friendly. Definitely not a hotel I would ever stay in again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: knpontour
Reviews.Content: This place was great. It was a small room but it was clean, and tidy. The place had new sheets and towels. The staff were friendly and it was a great location near good resturants and the train station. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “do not even think of it!”
Reviews.Author: catwoman56
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed for 4 nights before we could find anything else. We were not expecting anything flash - just a comfortable, friendly place to sleep. But this was an absolute nightmare! Abusive and insulting staff. Shower too small so beware if you are bigger than a size 16. Cigarette burns in bed linen. Broken air conditioner was more like an air cooler that didn't work. This is a poor quality back packer hotel with unfriendly staff. We stayed in 3 other 3 Star hotels in Rome and cannot believe how the Kennedy got the same rating. JFK would be turning in his grave to have his name associated with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: redbidet
Reviews.Content: The Kennedy is in a good position just 50 metres from the main railway station.Room was a reasonable size but the shower cubicle was the smallest I have ever encountered.We had a view over the park which is at the side of the hotel.The staff were friendly and helpfull. The breakfast is self service,bread,croissants,cheese,jam,marmalade.The coffee is disgusting a cheap chiccory blend and the breakfast juice is more like a cheap diluted lemonade.Plenty of good cheap restaurants nearby including Jimmy,s opposite the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The breakfast was nice but our room was a bit disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: Kumaneko
Reviews.Content: The breakfast was very good with variety of bread, biscuits and croissants, all-you-can-eat. The coffee and espresso were very good too. However, they had put us in the apparently smallest ,twin room in the hotel with our sides against the wall and our feet against each other's with a closet in between. We had booked the hotel longer than 3 months in advance when the room rate was still high but it didn't give us any priority. We would rank it better if we were provided a better room.

Reviews.Title: “Small Room, but Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Travelchik_MTL
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at this hotel for the last weekend in August and didnt think much of it. There are plenty of other hotels in Rome which are probably better in terms of quality and price. When we arrived at the hotel, the front desk clerk quickly urged my boyfriend to sign some papers without consulting their material. He ushered us into a lobby, where we left our things and then we headed out to explore Rome as the room wasnt ready until 2. This hotel was situated right near the Termini station, where all the buses and trains are. This was the only advantage of staying at this particular hotel. Otherwise, the "superior" room was small and we were told that ALL the rooms in the hotel are extremely small. The bathroom in the room is probably the nicest part of the room. It seems newly redone and very clean, and the multiple shower heads have lots of pressure. The air conditioning in the room is centrally controlled throughout the hotel which doesnt cater to Rome's heat in the summer, and the bed was a bit rough. After requesting a room with a nice view, the room we received (#90), was on the first floor and had a terrible view. We faced a line-up of dumpsters and a park in renovation. At around 11, some truck came and emptied the garbage and it made a lot of noise.
