When we asked for another room, the front desk clerk offered no help and was rude about it, saying that we should not expect North American standards here. The breakfast at the hotel was mediocre and included a "variety of jams", glazed croissants, some bread, cereal and yogurt. It wasn't great, but it helped to start off the morning. If youre looking for service and quality for an affordable price, stick to franchised hotels as Italian privately owned hotels (particularily this one) are small and lack amenities such as a blow dryer. The maids did a good job cleaning the room and providing fresh towels. I didnt bother to take any pictures of this terrible hotel as it was nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Covenient to Termini station”
Reviews.Author: lilgecko
Reviews.Content: The location of the Hotel Kennedy is very covenient- just 2 blocks from the Termini railway station, which took about 5 minutes to walk to. The downside is, this is rather a scruffy, seedy area, especially at night: although we felt safe walking around, we were approached by people asking for cigarettes, etc, which felt a bit intimidating. We had a superior room on the 5th floor- lovely, newly decorated with thick curtains and a nice side view over a tree-lined square. It was clean and comfortable, and the bathroom was very nice- a good shower, quite powerful. No complaints there. The breakfast room was a bit squashed for space. The breakfast wasn't fancy- some varieties of cakes and bread and cereals- but enough for us. It was clean and well serviced. Staff were very friendly and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at decent price”
Reviews.Author: EuroTravellerToronto
Reviews.Content: The Kennedy Hotel turned out to be a great little hotel for us in a very convenient part of Rome within a couple of blocks of the train station. The location allowed us to easily roll our luggage to and from the station which saved taking a cab or the subway. We walked to all key areas of the city from the location. The room itself was clean and comfortable and the air conditioning was wonderful. The bathroom was recently redone and was nicely tiled. The shower was spacious and had doors that actually fully closed - unlike so many European showers where you spend 5 minutes after your shower mopping up the gallons of water on the floor. The continental breakfast was good; the front desk staff were friendly. We were a bit concerned about other reports which indicated the area was dodgey but we never found that. Instead it was an interesting mix - and far better less bland than an area we also stayed in, northeast of the Spanish Steps. One small point, the room didn't have a room safe so we had to use the main hotel safe which is only big enough to accomodate cash and tickets etc. All in all from our perspective it was a good little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good!”
Reviews.Author: SelinaB
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel we stayed at during our 3 week journey through Italy and Spain. We were on our honeymoon, and booked this after looking at the decent reviews here. It was in an excellent location. Close to Termini Station (which was great for subway access as well as car rental pick up and trains). The hotel was clean, the service was great, and the air conditioner worked hard, but it kept the room cool. (We were there during record high temperatures). We had a nice street view from our top floor, corner room. The staff were friendly and helpful (although when my husband wasn't around, he tried his hardest to win me over.) All in all, the hotel was perfect for economic travel, convenient location, and cleanliness. It had a nice old-romantic feel to it. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: jenniferrhea
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Kennedy Hotel. The location was wonderful! We were only steps away from Termini Train Station, where we could access our tour bus and catch the train to go on to Venice. The room was a nice size (especially compared to other European Hotels) and the bathroom was huge compared to our hotel in Venice. The breakfast was complementary and was very tasty. Plus, everyone who worked at the hotel was very nice and helpful. One person recommended dinner at a rooftop restaurant that was perfect. We would definitely recommend Kennedy Hotel to everyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Good standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: Speukes
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Kennedy. The rooms and the rest of the hotel are very clean, the staff is very friendly and is able to speak fluently english. The room itself could use new furniture, but the bathroom seemed almost new. The TV-stations that you can receive don't mean a lot (a bunch of Italian channels, MTV, CNN and BBC world), but in fact we didn't have the time to watch TV, there's enough to see outside! You're a few steps away from the Termini station where you can take the metro or any bus you like. The breakfastbuffet is standard, but you can ask for cappucino or any kind of coffee, and that made it nice. There is the possibility to use wifi-internet (if you pay for it), but it's probably better to go to the internetcafé close to the station, it costs 1 euro / 30 minutes for a fast computer with webcam etc.

Reviews.Title: “Very Central”
Reviews.Author: SussexSue1
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three night stay at the Kennedy Hotel. The area is a little run-down but it is central to all the attractions which was great. We walked to the Colleseum in ten minutes and the Spanish Steps in around 20 minutes. The room was small but very clean and the buffet breakfast was OK. However there was only one English channel on the TV and I had to request a hairdryer at reception. There are no tea or coffee making facilities in the room which we would have liked. One of the restaurants over the road from the hotel was an absolute rip-off but then so are a lot of the bars and coffee shops. My advice is to ask how much it is going to cost you before ordering. We paid 12 euros for a beer in a bar near to the Colleseum. A three course Chinese meal nearby was only 6 euros 50!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ilsonchick
Reviews.Content: Me and my Boyfriend went to stay at Hotel Kennedy in December for my 21st Birthday. It was booked online, never been before, and let me tell you it was AMAZING! i would recomend it to anyone whose visiting Rome! We stepped off the plane, onto a bus which cost 8Euros (tickets bought on plane for bus) the bus takes you to the terminal and 2 streets down from here about a 5 min walk is the Hotel, so a perfect spot!! The terminal provides trains and the metro to everywhere you need in Rome and back to the airport in the end. The hotel is on a corner of a quiet road, overlooking some lovely little restaurants which we tried and tested and they were gorgeous! The hotel has just been refurbished and was SPOTLESS! The staff were very very helpful and friendly and would do anything for you. The room was HUGE with a walk in power shower, b.day, full selection of toiletries, huge basin ceremic sink, a powerful hairdryer on the wall which proved perfect. We had a view of a monument statue which was amazing, a huge bed, the room was decorated in italian style, perfect for setting the scene. Full room service, tv with all channels his and hers wardrobe! Underbed space, sea shell lights, works of art on the walls, table, chairs, hallway and all for the cost of £250 for 3 nights for 2 people!!!! WHAT A BARGAIN!!! The Hotel has a reading room, lobby, smoking and none smoking areas, stunning reception with glass doors. The Breakfast was fantastic (Continental) cheeses, breads warm and fresh, yogurt, cakes, cereal, fresh fruit of the day. Room service was spot on they would bring you wine and beer up as there was no mini bar. I would give this hotel 11 out of 10!! it was warm, clean, tidy, friendly, cosy, periodic, A MUST GO TO!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: kiwibabyboomer
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Kennedy in August 2006. Our first experience of Italy. And it was not a good start. The reception area and staff were very cold and unfriendly. There was no coffee making facilities in our room and were bluntly told we had to go out for coffee. The area was very filthy and seedy. In fact the only plus was that it was close to the Termini. My partners daughter - who was working in Florence- came down to join us on our holiday and received a very rude cold reception from the staff, telling us she could only spend 10 mins in the room with us!! I would never in a million years recommend this hotel to anyone, nor will we ever set foot on it's dirty ripped foyer carpet. We were booked for 4 days but booked out after our third night.

Reviews.Title: “Saty somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: JJRICHMOND
Reviews.Content: ONLY stay here if you must. The hotel is one block from the train station, and the area is not very safe. Multiple trash cans were directly outside of the window and became a public toilet. Homeless were digging all night through the trash. The bathroom toilet flooded the room even after service. I will never suggest this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas in Rome”
Reviews.Author: 2Topsys
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Kennedy Hotel for a week last Christmas. We loved it! The staff were very friendly and the room was cleaned daily. The complimentary breakfast was nice and we were able to take some with us for snacks throughout the day. It is within walking distance of termini, the Colosseum and many other tourist attractions. The only thing that we didn't love was the location - which was a bit intimidating when darkness fell. The price is right and we would recommend this place to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Romance in Rome”
Reviews.Author: pnorgate
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel kennedy between the 15th to the 18th of November. I was looking for somewhere romantic in europe where I could take my girlfriend as a surprise for her birthday. plus the fact that I was planning to propose to her whilst i was there. I booked our flights to Rome through British Airways (they are doing great deals on flights from gatwick at the moment!) and their website recommended the hotel Kennedy as one of their hotels, giving it a solid rating for a 3 star at a great price. (I paid £160 for the 3 nights.) Before I booked it, I came on this site and a few others to read reviews about the hotel and was slightly un-nerved by some of the comments. still, undeterred by the "few" poor reviews i decided to go with the majority of the good comments and book the hotel for 3 nights. We arrived at Fiumicino airport in the early afternoon, collected our bags and easily followed the signs to the train station to catch the train to Rome Termini (it cost 22 euros for the both of us and lasted about 40 minutes) Having arrived at Rome Termini we set off walking to the hotel which was no more than 5 minutes away and was really easy to find. (You can catch the subway, from the Termini, to anywhere you like in Rome for 4 Euros. this is valid all day no matter how many times you hop on and off) We entered the hotel behind an elderly couple. (Who were being helped with their bags up the 5 or 6 steps by the receptionist guy) The reception area was small but cosy with various maps and tourist information for guests. We quickly had our documentation checked, given our room key and was in our room within 10 mins. The room wasn't huge but it had everything we needed for our stay. It was very clean, well presented with a comfy double bed, big wardrobes, a T.V. (with MTV, CNN and BBC World being the only english stations. But why would you want to watch T.V. when your in ROME???) The bathroom made very good use of its size and had a good size shower. The complimentary bathroom supplies were limited to soap and a shower cap. (which i must say, i did look rather fetching in!! :o) ) So bring your own shampoo and toiletries! Breakfast was continental. croissants, cerial, morning cakes, juice, tea and coffee. just enough to set you up for the day. The staff there were very friendly and happy to help with any queries my girlfriend or I had. I even emailed the hotel before our arrival telling them of my plans to propose and asking them if they had any ideas of where the best place to do it. I got a very prompt and nice reply from a lady called Alexia that works there who informed me of some very nice restaurants that she and her husband had been to. One being the Consolini. Which i booked through the receptionist while we were there. This was a little out of the way and off the tourist area which is what i wanted as it added to the romance. The food was fantastic but the service wasn't very good. The staff seemed to tend to the Italians before eventually come to us. Not sure if it was anything to do with us being tourists or not but it seemed like it. My advice would be to stick to the restaurants around the hotel. the food is just as good and at around half the price that i there. The area around the hotel is very misleading, after reading the comments on this site about how poor the area is i was very dubious about walking around at night. it really isn't as bad as first thought. granted, the streets aren't paved with gold but after braving it out we both felt very comfortable walking around. You just have to bear in mind that although it may be one of the richest cities in the world with all its "treasures" there are still a lot of poor and homeless people. this is aparent nomatter where you go. The traffic on the streets around Rome are very hard to get used to and if you're waiting for a break in the traffic before crossing then you'll be waiting a long time. You have to apply what i call "the Moses effect!" Like Moses and the "parting of the waves" you have to literally step out in front of the cars. it sound completely insane but if you step out into the road (still using caution though) the cars will magically part and let you past!! If you're not confident then just wait for an Italian to do it and see what happens. or just follow them. I finally asked my girlfriend to marry me whilst out on a walk at night after our meal. we went and sat at the side of the Colesseum (which looked amazing all lit up!) and I proposed to her there, and i am glad to say she said YES!!! I wanted it to be something she would never forget and hopefully she wont. (its not hard though because anywhere in Rome would have been equally romantic as it is such a beautiful city.) If you're looking at a hotel where you can be "wined and dined" then this is not the place for you, but if you want a clean, friendly, inexpensive place to lay your head when you are not looking at the wonderous sights in this fantastic city then i would recommend this hotel to absolutely everyone. Especially with the subway being so close to access virtuall anywhere in Rome. All in all our experience of Rome was a truely unforgettable one and one that was made all the more special by Alexia and the staff at the hotel kennedy. Many thanks to you all. Peter, Ashton-U-Lyne

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality for the Price”
Reviews.Author: PM-of-M
Reviews.Content: The Kennedy was a great hotel, if you keep in mind it is well priced and 3 stars. We stayed at the Kennedy in July this year, so were very glad the room had air conditioning. The room was a good size with a reasonable bathroom. It was clean and windows were double glazed, so there wasn't any noise from the streets below. The staff at reception were very friendly and helpful, and were willing to hold our bags while we looked around the day we checked out. Breakfast was also pretty good. While the location is a bit dodgy, it is close to Termini, and only a 25 minute walk to the Colosseum.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel and crazy people”
Reviews.Author: blosf
Reviews.Content: in Germany i have never seen bad hotels like this one. they want immediatly the money and some person are very rude

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JenniG
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in July as part of an extended trip in Itely. The hotel is one block away from Rome Termini station which enables you to hop on Rome's underground system to get around to all the major sights. You can also walk to the Colosseum (about 20 mins away). There are also many good cheap restaurants close by to the Hotel. Lift was available in the lobby to get to the upper floors of the Hotel. Our room was clean but the bathroom was a little cramped and the water didn't drain properly from the shower. Reception staff were friendly and the general tourist information provided in our room was very helpful. The location close to the station is a little seedy - we saw a guy going through an obviously stolen suitcase in the park opposite the hotel therefore you need to take the normal travel precautions.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for everything and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: HuddersfieldTourist
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnight on 13th Spetmber to allow us a couple of days to see the major sites in Rome - the hotel was about 2 minutes from the Termini and the nearest attraction was the beautiful Santa Maria Maggiore Church which is a definate " must see inside ( free admission) " wherever you stay in room. It's as good inside as the Pantheon. The hotel breakfast was exceptional in choice and quantity starting at 7.15 am til 9.45 am. Rooms are on one of 4 floors and there is a lift. Air conditioning was working and limited toiletries were also supplied in the bathroom.Room was not noisy as windows were double glazed which helped.We paid 99 Euros for one double room with breakfast for night - that's about £70 or in US $ about $130 on the current exchange rate. There is a room to leave your luggage in on your last day after checking out by 11.00 AM so you can pick it up on your way back to the Termini. The Colosseum is a good ten minute walk away - we walked to all the sites in our time but the Vatican may be worth getting a Metro line A train and then just walking back taking in various sites depending on the route you choose.Piazza Navona was a bit over rated in the guide books in my opinion - also the Palatine was likewise - otherwise worth a look at are the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps,The Santa Maria Maggiore Church, The Pantheon, The Colosseum,The Roman Forum area and the Papal Tombs at the Vatican + St Peter's Square - all these are free admission except the Colosseum which at the time of our visit cost 11 Euros each and we queued for nearly 30 minutes at 10.30 am on a Thursday to get in.

Reviews.Title: “Ugh.”
Reviews.Author: Tuckerson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Kennedy Hotel for three nights during our honeymoon last month. Although we were certainly not expecting the same luxury of our hotel on the Amalfi Coast, we were extremely disappointed when we arrived. If the Kennedy Hotel is three stars, then I would really hate to see a one-star, especially given what we were paying for the room. The neighborhood, although very convenient to the Termini Station, was quite far from all of the attractions. We walked everywhere (although we took taxis after dark because we were so uncomfortable walking through the area around the hotel), but it was definitely a hike. Upon entering the hotel, we had to drag all of our luggage up a staircase to check in. The lobby was tiny and dingy. The desk staff was pleasant enough, but not able to offer things like an extra pillow upon request. In our room, the beds were two twins pushed together, with a comforter that looked like it had seen much better days. There was a single bare flourescent light strip over the bed. The bathroom was tiny, and the shower had a major drainage problem. The water tempature in the shower tended to go unexpectedly from scalding to freezing. The toiletries were extremely minimal, and there was not so much as a soap dish in the shower stall...we ended up having to use a plastic cup. The airconditioner kept the room from being stifling, but it was definitely not cool. There was a plastic bucket underneath it where it was dripping, which we had to empty several times. Our view was of an alley, and we could hear street traffic all night. We checked out the continental breakfast but decided to find our own meal instead. Overall, I would absolutely not stay in this hotel again, nor would I recommend it to others. Had I known what we were getting, I would definitely have coughed up the extra money to stay in a safer, more central location with better facilities. In fact, were it not for the fact that the room was required to be prepaid and they would not give us any refund whatsoever, we would have checked out after our first night.

Reviews.Title: “Kennedy Hotel is OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at the Kennedy Hotel and I concur with most of the reviews previously written here. Since we arrived before check-in, we only had to wait about 15-20 minutes for our room (and yes, you do have to roll your luggage up a couple of steps to reach the reception area, and you are required to immediately pay for at least a few nights of your trip while you check-in, and the elevator is narrow). The reception staff was very nice to us on a daily basis (they do hold your room key for you when you go out). Our "superior" room was on the fifth floor. It was comfortable, cool (a/c worked fine), quiet (the double paned windows do help), clean (maid service is VERY GOOD), beds were comfortable too (altho they were two twin beds pushed together). The bathroom was very nice (shower stall with rain showerhead, bidet, toilet, sink) but very small and minimal toiletries provided. Two people could not comfortably be in there at the same time as well. Upon opening the bathroom door, it would hit side of the bidet. There was no safe in the room either. We left things locked in our suitcase and on the first day, we left change out on a table for the maid which she did not touched (so staff is extremely honest & secure-wise). Our room had a strange slanted ceiling which gave us the feeling we were staying in an attic which was a tad disconcerting. We also had no view to speak of (overlooked the side of working-class residential buildings). Every morning continental breakfast was served as has been described here. The cappucinos were excellent but otherwise the meal was nothing to get excited about. I did like the baskets placed on the dining tables that contained melba toast, cookies, muffin, crackers, etc. The location of the hotel is another mixed bag. Yes, it is completely convenient to Termini Station where we availed ourselves to the metro and buses, and got around the entire city without a problem. The Basilica of Santa Maria Maggiore is indeed just a couple of blocks away but everything else is a trek altho doable. We walked for miles so if you don't mind hiking, you can walk to everything - including the Vatican - altho I don't recommend it. The main problem with the hotel is the neighborhood it sits in. We're ex-New Yorkers so we're used to grimy urban areas, but nonetheless, we felt slightly turned-off by the immediate neighborhood (in NY terms, it was like staying next to the Port Authority Bus Terminal). The neighborhood was dirtier than other Roman neighborhood. At night, it was dark and creepy with very low-class and scary individuals stumbling around outside (we're convinced we saw a drug deal going on down the street). We walked around and found a very mixed immigrant population (indians, africans, chinese, arab) living in the neighborhood, which there is nothing wrong with but not what we expected for our vacation spot. I would not recommend this hotel for people who are not used to this type of environment. Lastly, I really don't think it's a 3-star hotel, but perhaps in Rome that is a 3-star status.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel, Excellent Location minutes to Termini Station”
Reviews.Author: Newo
Reviews.Content: Excellent location situated minutes from the Termini Station. Good tourist information and map supplied on checkin. Very good & comfortable room, small clean bathroom in a very good condition. Breakfast was an excellent continental style spread. Juice, cereals, fruit salad, rolls & croisants & breads, cheese, jams, yogurts and cake & tarts. A variety of coffee, tea, chocolate drinks available. Very good price offered on the web. Remember to compare websites as prices do vary for specific dates. Yes, I will stay again and will recommend it family, friends and business colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Party”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Once we arrived at the Reception desk of the Kennedy Hotel we received a very warm greeting. We were a party of 10 over from Ireland to Rome for a family wedding. The Receptionists were very help at all times during our stay. The rooms were very clean and spacious (we had 6 rooms altogether booked). The location was perfect, only one block away from Terimi station. We will definitely be going back to Rome and booking into the Kennedy Hotel also...highly recommed it. Note: there is no safe facility in every room, you hire a box for 5 euro at reception and you are given a key that you keep with you at all times. The individual safe boxes are then placed in a big safe.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Kennedy!”
Reviews.Author: Anod
Reviews.Content: We (two American women, ages 77 and 78) spent April 20-30 at the Kennedy Hotel and loved everything about it - including the location just a short block from Termini station. Our room was quiet and comfortable, the multi-lingual staff unfailingly cordial and helpful, breakfast excellent. Our only regret was not having planned a longer stay in bella Roma! The hotel arranged for a driver to drive us to Fiumicino airport (the big one A.K.A. Leonardo da Vinci) at 5:00 a.m. for our return flight to San Francisco. There were just the two of us, the car was "elegante", and the ride cost a total of 40 euro, plus we gave him a 10 euro tip. Before arriving in Rome we bought tickets online for Colosseum and Vatican Museum tours, thereby avoiding the waiting lines for admission (there were thousands in line at the Vatican!) Rick Steves' guidebook, Rome 2006, was invaluable, as were many websites we consulted - including this one! - before our trip. One recommendation we have for new travelers to Rome : on your first day there take one of the double-deck bus tours (sit on the top deck) that go to all the landmark places. During our glorious stay in Roma we walked a lot, took city buses, and taxis; we never needed to use the Metro. We also took day trips to Pompei (on our own by train) and Ostia Antica (group tour). After 10 days at the Kennedy Hotel it felt like home, and we will surely stay there next time!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for the Termini”
Reviews.Author: STACumbriaEngland
Reviews.Content: The Ryanair bus drops off and picks up at the Termini which only 5 mins from this hotel. We arrived at noon and only had to wait 20 mins for our room so could set off sightseeing. The reception staff were helpful, though I was surprised at having to pay for the room up front especially as they had my credit card details. We booked a superior room which was clean and tidy though rather small and had a constant smell of bad drains or sewerage. I feel £105 for the room per night is too expensive for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great 3 star value”
Reviews.Author: red ned
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from Rome, having spent three nights in the Kennedy. It is within 5 mins of Termini station from where you can catch the buses or underground to most parts of the city. a three day pass costs 11euro for unlimited travel. The staff in the hotel are very friendly and extremly helpful. We arrived at 12 noon and our room was ready. The room was spotless and comfortable. The bathroom was a good size with a power shower. There was a TV in the room , although we never had it on. There is far to much to do and see in Rome, other than watch TV. The receptionist gave us maps and advice on bus routes, sights and resturaunts which was all very helpful. Breakfast was continental and consisted off Juice, cereals, fruit, croisants, rolls, cakes, biscuits, cheese and jams with tea and coffee or a cappucini. Some reviews complained about the area being unsafe but we didn't find that. in fact, whilst we were safe in Rome , my Daughter had her mobile phone snatched while out shopping at home in Belfast. The Kennedy is a welcoming comfortable Hotel to which i would have no hesatation in returning to.

Reviews.Title: “The guy at reception is evil.”
Reviews.Author: tmp24
Reviews.Content: I HATED this hotel. Seriously. Seething hate. I stayed here on the last night of my trip to Italy which was for 2 weeks. Throughout that time I stayed in budget/cheaper hotels and yet always had great, safe, clean rooms with excellent service. I payed the most for this crappy little room with horrific service. I was livid. First of all the only reason to stay at this hotel is to be near the station. If you're leaving the next day for a flight, it is convenient. Other than that it's a terrible, depressing neightborhood and if you're going to spending any time at all in Rome I would not recommend this part of town. It's dirtier, has no charm and more pickpockets. As for this hotel in specific from the second I walked in the door I couldn't stand it. I had been travelling for about 6 hours to get there and when I got there the rude man at the desk asked for my passport immediately, asked me to fill out paperwork and wouldn't let me into my room before I paid for it. Uncalled for. He wouldn't even let me drop off my bags first and let me splash my face even though I told him I was exhausted. Then he proceeded to tell me that breakfast ended exactly at 10:00 and that I had to check out by 11:00 on the dot. Good day to you too! Yikes. I felt like a criminal not a guest. To top it all off, after spending the day and evening with a friend of mine, I invited him up to my room after dinner and sightseeing so he could pick something up and so we could hang out some more and say goodbye before I left the next morning and the same cranky man would not let him in the room with me! Can you believe that? How can they determine whether a person has a guest or not? I've never experienced anything like that before and since I'd paid for the room I don't see how that was right but there you go. Do NOT stay at this hotel. The other people were just as rude the next morning and kept reminding me to check out by 11:00. I speak Italian too - which usually makes people even nicer. Not in this case.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Loz_00
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights with my sister and found the reception staff EXTREMELY friendly! It was a 5 min walk to Termini Station but we caught the "Hop on Hop Off" bus instead - train station was a bit too rough for our liking! Breakfast was nice - great 3 star quality! Staff recommended exceptional restaurants near the Republica which we found to be really enjoyable! Room was a bit small, but not unbearable - particularly if your only there to sleep! All in all, I'd recommend this to those tourists who are on a bit of a budget - and aren't too fused about the little things at the hotel - concentrate more on the sights... Rome is one of the most beautiful places I've been to!!!!

Reviews.Title: “OK but ...”
Reviews.Author: Livia
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through the hotel's web site a few months' in advance. It is a few minutes walk from Termini on the eastern side of the station. Our room on the 6th floor and its bathroom were of a good size and had been recently renovated, but there was a persistent "blocked drain" odour. It was too cold to leave the window open day and night so sometimes the room was quite unpleasant. Breakfast was the typical 3-star breakfast - no hot dishes, toast, or fresh fruit. Staff were generally friendly and helpful. Overall, reasonable 3-star value if they fix the drains.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Kennedy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back yesterday from my stay in Rome and at Hotel Kennedy with my sister. We booked our trip through STA travel where they told us this hotel was a 5-10 min walk from the big sites such as Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. In reality, it is at least a 30 minute walk to each! Although it is conveniently located near Termini, it was inconvenient to walk for hours to and from the sites after expecting to be close. The area around Termini station was not very safe, and as two girls traveling, we tried to be back to the hotel no later than 9PM. As for the hotel itself, the staff was nice and spoke good English. Our standard double room was a disappointment. The bathroom was TINY! You could not sit on the toilet because you legs would hit the shower so you had to sit on a diagonal and I am not a tall person (only 5'6"). If the shower door was closed the you would have to put you legs over the buday. The shower itself was very small and uncomfortable. The hotel said it had sattelite TV but we only got a few channels and the u.s. news station did not work. Our phone only worked if you held the cord in the back on a diagonal in the plug. We asked the front desk for a new phone, and after them not trusting us (we had to call them to prove it did not work) they said they would replace it the next morning, but they never did. The breakfast was all you can eat, but we did not have anything good besides the cappucino, the milk was warm the the rolls were hard. The walls were paper thin, we were awaken early by the maids talking outside our door, the people next door using a hair dryer and the people above us walking in high-heel shoes. Overall, after wanting to switch hotels, we sticked it out at Hotel Kennedy because it was only where we slept. It was not terrible, but no where near 3 stars on a US standard!

Reviews.Title: “Good value & location”
Reviews.Author: AnnieLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kennedy in Jan 2006, we found the service to be friendly and staff helpful. We arrived at about noon and our room was ready - clean and comfortable although fairly basic. Hotel is close to the main Terminal Station (5 min walk). We took the metro a few times from the main station. Perfect small hotel for short break, breakfast was continental style and they allowed us to leave our luggage on the last day whilst we went sightseeing. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Richiewoodhouse
Reviews.Content: Went to Rome at the end of November 2005. The hotel is located just next to the main railway station. The hotel is small but clean and tidy. We were given the suite that had 2 very large bedrooms and a lovely bathroom. The weather in Rome was cold and when I asked if the heating could be turned up I was told that it came on at 6pm. We Froze until 6pm!! Got the hotel through Octopus Travel for £60 a night per room including breakfast. Great Value for a good hotel. As for the location. This is not good. The area around Termini Rail Station is a DUMP. Saying that, most of Rome is a dump. If you are looking for a London/Paris city, don't go to Rome. I know that the Italians invented Grafiti but it is everywhere. You can't see out of the Metro trains because of Grafiti. Talking of the Metro. I stopped a thief picking my wife's handbag on the Metro. This girl looked like everyone else but she was a thief. Also be aware of the mother with baby routine. What happens is that a mother with a small baby will come up to you (especially if you have suitcases) and shove the baby in your face. Two boys of about 13 will then pick your pockets. This happened to my Brother in Law. The only good point about Rome is St. Peter's. We climbed to the very top. What a view. Also we say the Pope when he was being driven out of the Vatican. If you are not into religous history give the Vatican Museum a miss. Also the Spanish Steps are just some steps and the Trevi Fountain is not up to much (more of a small water fall).

Reviews.Title: “Kennedy...You've done me proud!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back this second! Thank you TripAdvisor, you really helped! You said it was great and it was!!! Kennedy...You've done me proud! (The staff - get new ones!)

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having traveled around Europe, I was pleasently surprised when we got to our room. It was actually roomy.....not to mention you could actually move around in the bathroom. The staff was wonderful. They even let us use their computer to download our pictures to our iPod. They also spoke wonderful English there. They were all so nice and very helpful. They also kept our bags the whole last day we were there (our flight didn't leave until 10 that night). They have information about tours at the front desk as well. They were ok, don't know if I would recommend them though. The hotel is a block away from the metro. Which is a great way to get around Rome. Also the transportation to and from the airpot is great. Even though our driver going to the airport wasn't the greatest and dropped us off a little far from the front door in the rain........it would be much cheaper then taking a taxi to it.........or for that fact a lot safer than driving!!!!! :) We will stay at this hotel again when we go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for public transportation”
Reviews.Author: cmenter
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent two weeks in Europe; Rome and the Kennedy Hotel was our third location. We arrived in Rome late in the evening so the walk to the hotel from the train station can be a little intimidating as it is not in the best location. Upon arrival in the hotel our fifth floor, superior room was ready. I am glad that we upgraded here and got the superior room as it was recently renovated as was the entire fifth floor. The room was small with no view but because of the refurbishment, it was quite nice and very clean. The bathroom was just lovely. The front desk staff was helpful each time we asked for assistance on restaurants or directions. The breakfast rooms are small and crowded as the hotel was full when we were there. The staff put out a plentiful spread each day so one does not go away hungry. The great thing about this hotel is the location to the train station, bus terminal, and metro stop. We only had two days in Rome and were able to see so much since transportation was so easy to get. The Colosseum is with-in walking distance which is nice. If you are a cat lover, there is a cat sanctuary, “Torre Argentina where approximately 250 feline friends have found respite from the chaos and traffic amongst the oldest temples in Rome (400-300 BC)”. People from all over the world have adopted cats from here. My husband and I stumbled upon it on the way to the Jewish Ghetto and ended up spending about an hour taking pictures of the cats and visiting the shop. All in all the hotel is fine, the location is a bit sketchy at night, but our stay there was without incident.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel with nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights recently. Very good value for a well located and clean 3*. Despite how the hotel may look at first sight from the exterior, small lobby and breakfast rooms which are perhaps in need of modernisation, the hotel rooms themselves have been refurbished to a very good standard and are clean. We were on the 5th floor in a very pleasant superior room with pretty home-style furnishings and nice modern bathroom (complete with rainbath showerhead), facing the small park behind the hotel. The windows are double glazed but if you are a light sleeper the traffic noise (especially from the scooters) will disturb you so bring earplugs. Front desk service varies according to who is on duty (e.g. the tall chap with glasses and mousey hair is spectacularly unhelpful so question why he is in the hospitality business at all, but this seems to be his general demeanour as opposed to anything personal towards guests). Would recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: Mely
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is great. They're very friendly, speak English, and the morning breakfast is fantastic. They serve cereals, juices, coffe, tea, breads and all kinds of spreads. The room we got was simply too small. It was ok for a 3-night stay, but I would've preferred something a little larger, which they have, because we looked at the floor layout and we had the smallest room available, the least expensive. The shower was tiny and it was right up against the toilet. The location is ok, not great. It's nice that it is right by the Termini train station, but it is not within walking distance to the main sites. You can take the bus, which stops right in front of the hotel. All in all, I would prefer to stay somewhere else the next time I visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “a little dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: Pete_Travelcare
Reviews.Content: Just back on Monday. Loved Rome, hotel excellent location although in a slight dubious area. The staff at the hotel were nice enough but the room allocated 122 was tiny. I would say it was maybe even a single room becasue we saw a room door open accross the corridor and that was double the size of ours. The bed was comfortable enough, no tea/coffee making facilities and the smallest shower compartment I have ever seen. The breakfast was acceptable but the bar was a non event with nobody ever there and nobody ever serving behind it. The area was good as main attractions walkable apart from the vatican. The metro is also good with each journey only costing 1 euro but it is a bit complicated to use as you have to buy a ticket and then you must get your ticket stamped in machine to validate if not it is a 25 euro fine. Information centres are also not very useful and asking people for help is very hit or miss. I loved the city but don't expect marble buildings everywhere. This is a city like any other big, bustling and dirty with a lot of homeless people and begging going on and good luck trying to cross a road. The hotel was clean and in a good location but that to me is all it had going for it. enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Some_One_Dances
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, updated. Staff friendly and courteous. Great location. I would definitely use the Terravision bus to get TO the center of Rome. (I cannot say the same about getting back. It is a bit chaotic at this point in time and could do with more structure. I would advise a taxi to get to your flight on time, or if you can deal with the pickpockets, etc that abound - go ahead and use the Metro and local bus services.) After you leave the bus, you can either walk into the Termini station and walk straight thru to Giolitti, or you can walk around the station and end up on Giolitti as well. Once there, head one more block away from the station. You will either end up on Turati itself, or it will say Amandola. If Amandola, turn left and keep walking - Amandola turns into Turati. Our room was clean, the tiled floor nice and cool on our aching feet. It was a bit narrow and confined. There was an extra blanket in the wardrobe, as well as two extra pillows. The double bed was in actuality two twin mattresses pushed together. The view was an alley. The bathroom was fairly clean (a used cigarette butt was left in the window sill upon our arrival), but I could not call it spacious. The shower stall was tiny... my husband had to squeeze into it sideways as the opening was only about a foot wide. I had trouble washing my long hair as there was not enough room to bend over to wash the underside. The toilet also was situated at a weird angle to the shower stall, which made sitting a rather gymnastic fete. They have two waiting rooms and a library with some guidebooks in various languages, as well as novels. We enjoyed the waiting room while we waited to check in and after we had checked out. (They allow you to use the rooms if waiting for a later flight.) They offer luggage storage, which we did not ask about - but also the Termini station has a left luggage facility for you to check in your luggage for a fee of around 4 Euro for five hours. The line does get rather long, and so we opted to keep our bags with us and hung out in the station on our last day as we waited to leave for our flight. Breakfast times change (I've seen it written for different times and none of them matched), but they should let you know at check-in. It is a simple repast. Depending on how you do with the typical Italian breakfast (coffee and a croissant) you could always hit a restaurant on your way out. Oh, when you leave the room, you leave the key with the front desk. When you come back, you get the key back. You can easily walk to the Colosseum from the hotel. Turn left and left again and keep walking until you come to the Maggiore Plaza. From there, look for Cavour and then walk down that road until you come to the end of it (there will be signs for the Roman Forum, which is pretty much in front of you by then). Look left, and you will see the outcropping of the Colosseum. For most anything else, I would suggest the Metro. And a GOOD map. We also kept our eye out for tour groups (a lot of them were headed for things of "importance"). --We never did find the Trevi Fountain! (It's behind a hotel off the main road.) Signs for the attractions are sparse and at times confusing. Also, be diligent about those pickpockets and beggars. There are good websites out there that give tips on what to look out for (some of the scams, etc) as well as how to protect your valuables. I had my pockets rifled thru extremely quickly on a particularly crowded subway ride, but thankfully I kept nothing in my pockets.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: kez8905
Reviews.Content: this was a clean hotel very near to the main train station which was convenient because Rome is so large you have to walk quite far in order to see the sites so getting on a metro is easier! Breakfast was plentiful with fruit salads, cereals, and lots of flavoured jam! The room itself was nice and clean with a tv but I found the 3* in florence much nicer, maybe that is just down to the hotels though. The staff were also helpful and arranged a transfer to the airport for us.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Everthing About Rome”
Reviews.Author: suzannejuliet
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a trip to Rome. After weeks of reading reviews on hotels, we settled on the Kennedy Hotel, mainly due to the location (convenient for the station) the price and the facilities the hotel offered. We were not disappointed ! We booked the hotel through Venere, which proved very quick & easy, and flew in to Ciampino by Ryanair so we were able to purchase our transfer coach tickets ( Terravision coach ) on board the aircraft, it's 8 euro single or 13.50 return. If you have to buy your ticket when you land, the ticket booth is to your right as you enter the arrivals hall. The bus waits for the passengers, they run half hourly & the journey time is around 20 minutes to the Termini station, the bus stops on Vai Marsala, so you only have to walk through the station, cross the Via Giovanni Giolitti, go a block to either the via Amandola or if you're on the via Filippo Turati you'll see the hotel. It takes about 5 minutes to walk from the station. All the hotel staff were very friendly, there is still some renovation work going on, but it's not intrusive. The room we had was on the 5th floor, easily reached via the modern lift. Although compact in size, it had two windows, a small wardrobe ( closet) a desk, nightstands, luggage stand phone, Sat TV ( one BBC world channel & one CNN - other channels were Italian) a huge very comfortable bed & that wonderful invention, air conditioning ! The bathroom was very modern, with large shower, basin, loo & bidet. The bedlinen was crisp & changed daily, as were the large soft bath towels. Note that there are no room safes ( although the things we left in the rooms were not touched) nor is there a mini bar. The hotel has a bar area downstairs along with two lounge areas & a small library - we never used these during our stay. Breakfast ( served 7.15-9.45) is taken in a choice of three charming interconnecting rooms. The breakfast consists of 4 cereal varieties, hot croissants, bread rolls, various cakes, yoghurts, tinned fruit salad , jams, processed cheeses, jams & a variety of biscuits, crackers & german bread. The orange juice is OK & the tea variety is good but the cappucino is wonderful & freshly made for you. We walked to all the sights, not wanting to miss anything by using the metros, buses or trams. If you want to use the bus etc, first buy your tickets either in the station or at a ' Tabacchi '. Remember to validate your ticket when you enter the bus. The restaurants we most enjoyed were the 'Nouva Stella', on via Daniele Manin, & 'Baires' , an Argentinian restaurant on via Cavour, not far from the Colosseum. Buy a gelato from anywhere, the ice cream is wonderful ! There's a good supermarket, 'SMA' situated near the Sta M Maggiore, just walk down via Gioberti. It even sells pieces of cooked chicken if you fancy having a picnic ! The little parks we found were all locked though, probably due to the beggars/homeless of which there are many. We never had a problem with pickpockets nor did we see any danger. There is grafitti & litter as in any major city,........shame! We bought day return tickets to Florence from the self-service machines in the station( lots of helpful English speaking staff around ) on the Eurostar, journey time 1 hour 35mins, cost 58.88Euros for two, one way. It was well worth it, Florence is beautiful. We ate a great pizza in the 'Yellow Bar' & wandered around the markets selling fantastic leather goods. We had a great time & would stay there again, thank you to Venere & to the Hotel Staff for making it so pleasant to be in Rome !

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, clean Hotel for a good price and good located”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Kennedy Rome in July 2005. This is a great hotel and a good value. Rooms are well kept and the staff is very helpful. Good breakfast. The kennedy's close proxsimity to the terminini station was great (Airporttrain, Metrostation (both lines)) and you can walk to the sights. If you want a nice, clean Hotel for a good price - this is the perfekt deal.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a FAB hotel. Clean,clean, clean and definately value for money! The rooms are neat, the bathroom was huge and everyone freindly. Breakfast was plentiful. Will definately return to stay there again! Convinient location as well!

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Kennedy Rome in May 2005, we found this an excellent hotel to stay at. Despite renovations our rooms were spotless and staff courteous and helpful, we would recommend this hotel to anyone. Breakfasts were plentiful with a good choice. This is a great location for train station and buses to the airports (five minutes walking distance). We would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: daisynena
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Kennedy. The hotel is quite nice. We got a renovated room, and I was expecting a closet because we were in Europe, but the room was spacious and the bathroom was huge. Expect noise because they are renovating; this usually begins in the early morning, so wasn't a factor that disturbed sleep really. They have a decent continental breakfast, the staff is very nice, and the location is pretty central. By the train station, so not the cleanest or most glam area, but perfectly fine. There are people out and some businesses open late at night, so I never felt unsafe.

Reviews.Title: “Kennedy was great”
Reviews.Author: Hamule
Reviews.Content: We booked the Kennedy with BA and were not expecting much. I was pleasently surprised. Upon check in we went to our room only to find out it was a suite. The kennedy's close proxsimity to the terminini was great. Lot's of inexpensive really good resturants are near by. I don't reqire a lot out of a hotel all I want is clean, safe, and freindly. The Kennedy met all of those requirements. It is not the Ritz but I felt I got everything I could have ask for. I would stay there again and also recomenend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great room”
Reviews.Author: kmr2r
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel on BA site, and we feel we got a great offer. The room we had was fabulous! It was lovely and a great view of the aquarium next door. The staff was nice; breakfast was plentiful. I still think about the lovely rolls. The linens were clean (although not new) and the bathrooms were cleaned everyday! The hotel location was extremely convenient- we walked everywhere. My two cautions: IF you have allergies, you should be aware that the hotel only uses the air-conditioning during certain times of the year (they told me that they would not turn it in since it was only late March ( I didn't really press the issue however since my allergies surprisingly didn't flare up and it really wasn't that hot as it turned out). Secondly, I, personally, would not have felt comfortable walking down the street alone after dark since I am rather small woman (that wouldn't really be smart in any city however I suppose..). There were a couple questionable, and somewhat, aggressive people out in the alley beside the hotel around midnight. Since I was with my husband each night, I felt completely fine, so unless you are a small woman who wants to walk alone after dark, the neighbor seems safe enough. Also, the neighborhood at the opposite end of the termini is pretty sketchy so you should be sure that you are walking in the right direction when you exit the termini- I got confused about which door I exited and got somewhat turned around (don't go left out of the termini- Go straight or right unless you are positive you know which direction you are headed). You need to walk straight for a block when leaving the MAIN exit and then turn left on onto Fillipo Turati. You only got down about a block or so). I still miss the roar of the Vespas!

Reviews.Title: “Try And Find A Better 3* Hotel For The Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Kennedy is a 3* hotel, I have stayed there 4x (March 02, 03, 04, 05) for between 10-14 days each visit. I have skimmed thru the reviews and I will agree with some. Termini is not a pretty or romantic location but it is safe. I have spent 3 months in this area on 8 trips and have never had a physical concern about my safety. The shower stalls are small but at 6'2" 275lbs I managed to use them :). If you are on the Via C. Cattaneo side you can hear those 0200 trash trucks. I didn't hear any construction noise until after 0800 on all my visits. The rooms and elevator are all new and cleaned daily. They are average+ European size, nicely decorated for a hotel, pleasant not dreary with a large closest, desk/chair, night table, suitcase stand, ensuite w.c., tv, phone. The breakfast comments have me baffled? For a 3* and even some 4* Italian hotels I have stayed in their b'fast is above average. Granted no meat or eggs but a choice of 3 different fresh bakery cakes, hot croissants (my favorite), 2 choices of bread, 2-3 different cereals, a few different yogurts, the tables have a basket with different kinds of packaged cookies/crackers/bread and a wide variety of jams and spreads. For drinks, coffee (expresso, cappuccino, americano), tea, milk and ok that watered down OJ that they all serve:). An all-you-can-eat buffet in 3 nice interconnecting b'fast rooms. The reception is open 24hrs but they do run a quiet hotel, the vast majority are middle-aged (Germans, some Americans, French and younger Japanese). So I can see them having problems with late-nighters coming back from a Pub-Crawl :). The staff has always been very friendly and welcoming to me. This year ('05) because of the Dollar/Euro rate I was looking around for a cheaper hotel but I decided to bite-the-bullet because I like this hotel and it's staff. As I said in my 'Subject Line' try and find a better deal in this location for a 3* hotel that offers what the Kennedy does. In 8 trips I haven't. So for a 3* in this location I give it an Excellent (5) rating. Please feel free to email me if you have any questions, put ROME-KENNEDY in the 'subject line' so I'll see it among the Spam. paradiselost@webtv.net Regards, Walter

Reviews.Title: “Okay rooms, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: fsufan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights...very convenient location walking distance from Termini station (main train station and main metro station). I had read that this hotel was recently renovated, but they are still doing renovations and I don't think that our room had been recently renovated. The room was a little bit shabby and our television didn't work. The bathroom had some mildew. The walls were a bit thin, as we could hear when anyone walked down the hallway. The breakfast was average...typical European breakfast : rolls, croissants, yogurt, cheese, coffee, etc. The staff was very helpful - suggesting nice restaurants, calling taxis, chilling and opening wine for us. In general, location is great and this was one of the less expensive hotels that I found in "moderate" price range. Would recommend this hotel if you can get a good price.

Reviews.Title: “We would definately return!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights 12-15/3/05 and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Although the hotel was obviously not a five star, it was very clean, friendly and convenient, an absolute bargain for the price! Our room overlooked the central courtyard and the view was indeed obscured by scaffolding as the external walls of the hotel were being renovated. However, notices apologising for the disruption were posted all over the hotel. (well, we all have to do our decoration and repairs at some point, don't we) We agree that the workmen started early, but you don't go to Rome to spend the whole day asleep in bed, do you! Although parts of the hotel looked as if they could do with a lick of paint, it was very clean and our room was cleaned every day.The tiled floors in the rooms are common place on the continent, and no doubt a blessing in the hot summer months!! Our towels were fine, fluffy, clean and changed daily. We can't comment on the size of the shower stalls as we had a bath with shower over, but I suspect the reference to 'the men's urinal' was actually the bidet!!! ( we were pleasantly surprised to find a four piece bathroom suite in a hotel of this price range!) The breakfast was great, continental in as much as it wasn't a full cooked English. Coffee, cappuccino, hot chocolate, tea etc, then unlimited juice, cereals, fruit, yogurt, cheese, croissants, breads,jams, cakes, biscuits!!! Much better than the usual cup of coffee and one croissant!! The staff were polite, helpful and spoke good English, and will arrange tours or taxis if you want them. Although the area around Termini is not the greatest, it isn't any worse than around the train station of any major city. There is graffiti all over Rome, not just around Termini. The Kennedy is in a very convenient location, two minutes walk away from the station, but we never once felt uneasy, even at night.We would not hesitate to recommend the Kennedy to anyone who wanted a reasonably priced hotel in a very convenient location and weren't expecting the RITZ for the price!!! You can do a lot worse than stay here, we would certainly return!

Reviews.Title: “It was a room...but thats about it!”
Reviews.Author: Elvenfire
Reviews.Content: The staff seemed to know nothing, about rome or about even there own room rules!!! How much is the cost of a stamp? Dont know! The room says to make a calling card call to come down to reception and ask for a free of charge call...They dont know that one either and that was listed in the room!!!!! The rooms are floored by tile...which is cold. The shower is SO small I hope you are not claustraphobic. I had a VERY hard time even getting in it without scraping my bossom badly. The towels were ratty and torn. The toilet was so close to the shower you had to sit sideways crammed against the men's urinal. There is construction work going on right now so you better be up by about 6:45am unless you can sleep through banging and drilling sounds that sound like they are right on your head. The listed "full" breakfast was continental....so I would hate to see what a continental breakfast was. This hotel is great if you want to be near the train station, walk to the colloseum. But if you need any help, would like decent service, or want a normal place to show...this is NOT the place for you. Price was right for getting a whole lot of nothing.
